Title: Cord overheats-fire hazard.
Review Content: Cord is too light. Overheats. Product malfunction a year after buying leaving me stuck this early spring with no heat except a oil radiator type. It was the only thing on and luckily the breaker flipped. I was trying to just use it a few minutes at a time to try and baby it the rest of the season. Nope. If my breaker had not flipped it would have caught fire.

Title: Great Little Heater
Review Content: I now own 3 of these heaters. I use them in the smaller rooms and it heats them up well. I tried it in a very large room but all it did was take the edge off the cold, it never really heated up the whole room. I typically leave it on full blast to heat up the room, then when it's a comfortable temperature, I turn down the thermostat and it will turn on and off as it maintains the temperature. The tip over feature works well, as soon as I pick it up to move it, or I tip it, it shuts off until I stabilize it again. It did have an odor when first running it, so I ran it outside for about an hour, and the smell was more tolerable, then as time went on the smell entirely went away. I find it easy to use, it's not too big, not too small, and looks like a typical Milkhouse heater.

Title: It works but with a few hiccups
Review Content: I live in a small studio condo with not enough either insulation or a small electric baseboard heater.  Comfort Zone Milkhouse heater to the rescue.  It took a while for it to get going, I was already thinking about a return when the heat started blowing. Yesss!! It works perfectly, heating up my small quarters.P.S. I don't worry about the electrical bill because all utilities are included in the monthly condo fee.Back to the heater. It has good features and not so good ones. I will begin with the goodpart. Overheat protection and tip-over protection. When I first set up my new milkhouse heater, I picked it up to look at the Cauton button, which is when the heater stopped working but started again once I set it on the floor.  I decided not to attach the handle because I don't intend to carry it around. Attaching the handle is easy, all you need is a flat screwdriver and 2 screws that are already in.  Maybe will attach when I am in the mood.BUT.  This heater is equipped with a 2-prong ever so slightly polarized plug. I am no electrician but am aware that everything nowadays has 3-prong plugs. All my antennae went up and I started researching which yielded a confirmation that a 2-prong plug is not safe.  It lacks a grounding prong crucial for safety. I have ended up unplugging it when not in use as per instructions.Both the plug and the cord get pretty warm when in use, and take some time to cool down. I really don't know what to think about this.  I hesitate to return the unit because I want to stay warm. One star off for that.There is another model currently on the market, Comfort Glow Milkhouse heater which is equipped with a 3-prong plug; unfortunately not offered here on Amazon.  One star off for that.By the way, I have ended up paying a few $$ more supposedly as a special for the prime members. Does this make sense? Actually the prime deal translated into receiving the heater a few days earlier; I wish that it was spelled out this way rather than referring to the prime.  But overall, the happy end, knock on the wood.

Title: Quieter than average
Review Content: I heat my garage shop with these during the winters and I’ve had quite a few over time.  For twenty bucks, they’re easy to replace.  This one is of classic, generic design and quality, and is commendable only in that it seems quieter than some of its predecessors.  The plastic knobs are poorly shaped and slippery, and they seem difficult to turn with cold, arthritic hands.  I wrapped cloth hockey tape on my knobs to make them easier to grip, which obviates the problem.All heaters of this kind deliver a maximum 1500 watts of heat to a room, so all that matters otherwise is how well the heater distributes the heat.  This one seems to have a weaker fan than priors, which may be better or worse for heat distribution.  In the trade-off, I opt for quieter over heat distribution, so I’m happy with that.I like this heater because it looks and works just like all the others before it, and it comes at a good price..

Title: Small and not powerful but built well.
Review Content: Overall for small spaces like a normal size bathroom this is ok and seemingly built well with metal casing and some plastic handles. It does not warm a garage per say or a 10 x 10 green house. I did however bring the plants and kenneled farm animals in closer together and made a temporary wall opposite of heater to help them through the low temps in the garage. It was warm enough to sustain them but. Still not as warm as expected. I decided to continue use of heat lamp with it Durning night temps. We had an emergency situation with our animals habitats being destroyed Durning recent storms. We bought this as it was a temporary emergent situation. Next year I will look for a larger option. I plan to try it in the camper and see if it would warm that area of space. It didn't work as planned in greenhouse or garage without improvisions.

Title: Very Effective Heater for Small Spaces
Review Content: This is the third of these small heaters I've bought, and I couldn't be more pleased with them.  We use them in small rooms (less than 100 sq ft) with no direct heat source, and they are very effective at keeping them warmer than they otherwise would be.  Since these rooms are infrequently occupied, we keep the heaters on their lowest setting, and that is more than adequate to maintain a reasonable temperature.  Highly recommended.

Title: So far, what I expected...
Review Content: Update, months later: FYI the rattling noise that happens after the unit is first turned on is mostly from metal (inevitably!) expanding as the thing warms up and the temperatures of varous parts even out. But because this startup rattling from metal expansion eventually vibrates some screws loose too, gently tightening those as needed helps if the racket gets louder or persists longer. This heater still quickly heats my large room - no problems, so far.The Milkhouse-style portable heater is what I've grown most accustomed to, usually just grabbing one off a local hardware store shelf last minute, whenever I find myself suddenly in need. So, I know, some of these last for years, but others not so much - and I'm choosing optimism today. The heaters I already own are stashed in storage lockers - elsewhere. Optimistic, I am, because this one works great, so far - quiet, with adequate heat production for a small area, as I desired and expected. Almost an oops: The handy carrying handle was buried near the bottom, all but hidden amid the unit's protective packaging, but thankfully I noticed, then easily screwed it on.

Title: Overall Very Good Quality and Almost Everything I Wanted
Review Content: I bought 5 of these heaters. The most significant quality of this particular heater is the safety switch in the bottom of the enclosure. This is a good thing, but pay attention to it. It is far better than the tilt switch on similar heaters I have bought that have a plastic arm on the tilt switch weight that melts, prevents the heater from turning on and renders the heater useless unless you bypass it and that renders it unsafe. You CANNOT get repair parts for any of these heaters, either. The downside is that you must have it sitting on a flat surface. I had one sitting on an uneven surface. The switch engaged initially, but later on, vibrated away from the high point it was on and the heater shut off. Make sure it is sitting on a flat surface.There one disappointment. I have owned MANY different makes and models of this type of milk house heater. The fans in these don't move air as vigorously as the models I replaced them with. That's important because it doesn't circulate heat as well and shuts down before it warms the whole area.The thermostat is a LOT better quality and more accurate than other mfrs and shuts down at a lower temperature. It has a "freeze" setting at 40 degrees marked on the panel. You can set it at this temperature and trust it will come on accurately and unattended to heat an area to prevent freezing. I have some heaters that don't shut down below like 60 degrees. This overheats my storage areas needlessly and eats up a lot of power.So far, I'm very satisfied with the heaters, but would be happier with higher velocity fans.

Title: Stinky at first, then better
Review Content: This thing stinks so much when first run that had to run it in a completely different building.Don't know why the device has a power light to indicate device has power. Why do I need a vampire device sucking power just to indicate that it has power? It seems lit all the time. I put it on a switch and turn it off when not in use.Smell went away after a few days. Heats well enough. Only used the lower power setting. Put out enough warmth didn't need the dial turned up far past the little fan icon. Used for an outdoor shed with a freezer. It's not that big, maybe 8 x 8. Was a real life saver when I couldn't find the little heater from the previous year. Showed up on time. Aired out (but had to air it out somewhere else, wow was that a strong odor) after a few days. Did what it's supposed to do. Don't like that the power light stays lit all the time. Oh well. A switch takes care of that.Power cord's on the short side. Most of these heaters have short power cords though.

Title: Most Puny Fan I Have Ever Seen in a Heater
Review Content: We have used various brands of milkhouse heaters for years. But we can't use these. When turned on, the little 2-blade fan starts out barely moving, then levels off at a very slow speed, and you think, "That's it?!?" With basically no fan, the heat oozes out of the heater, rises to the ceiling, and never mixes with the air in the room. Amazon had two options in this listing (black and gray), but the differences appear to go beyond just the color. Don't buy the gray.These are otherwise fairly well made. They are made in China, so they won't stand being kicked around. But with a better fan, they would be a decent heater.

Title: Seems Fragile
Review Content: I purchased a Honeywell branded Milkhouse Portable Heater close to 20 years ago. It lasted close to twenty years and was built well. It felt like it was made for a barn and could take a few kicks from those milk cows.Well, I was hoping for something similar and I'm a bit disappointed by the quality of the build. The metal is thin, its certainly smaller and louder than the Honeywell and I have this feeling that the first time I knock it over (and it feels more unstable than the Honeywell) something  is going to break on the outside or inside.Also, looking at all the images of the Milkhouse heaters, all the knobs, screws, and labeling appears identical suggesting they are all manufactured by the same company. You might as well by the cheapest one offered on Amazon.

Title: Hot Cord Fire Hazard
Review Content: Never trust a space heater that's not grounded. These 2 prong cords overheat fast, within minutes, becoming too hot to touch. Mine is in the garbage now, cord cut off for safety.I have similar space heaters that are grounded (3 prong plug). The cords get warm over time, but never too hot to touch.Space heaters should always be monitored. But, this 2-prong model shouldn't be run for more than a few minutes at a time, with major fire risk.

Title: Great little heater
Review Content: We purchased this to heat our 26 foot trailer where we are sleeping at night as we do construction in our house.  Although it was not sufficient enough in the dead of winter at 0 degrees, we supplemented with our propane central heater, it has worked independently for a good part of the winter, decreasing our propane bill. Electric is less expensive in our neck of the woods.  I plan on purchasing another one for our 6 x 8 greenhouse that is going up now, as it didn't falter all winter, didn't make significant noise and the temperature was easy to control. I've been through a lot of electric heaters lately and this one is the best.

Title: 2 years going strong
Review Content: I have had this heater for two years now.  It is still going strong.  I like that it has multiple temperature and fan/wattage settings.  The fan settings allow me to really pump up the heat when the lower setting isn't enough and it pumps out more heat.  The temperature setting is basically just a limit- so when the room gets to a certain temperature it turns off.  I like that I can adjust for what I want.  Produces a large volume of heat (I sit about 4 feet away at my desk).  Knobs are easy to use and heater is small and portable enough to re-locate if needed.This thing is a life saver for a cold office!  Even when my office was in the mid 30's one day, this thing made enough heat to keep me comfortable.

Title: small but mighty!
Review Content: my boyfriend and i bought this for our living room because it is SO expensive to run the heat in our house. this was an excellent alternative! we turn it on to the highest setting and after even just half an hour, the ENTIRE living room is so cozy! it is a small living room, but still! it’s a lot of space for such a small heater!very easy to set up and use! i am a little concerned about durability; we use it daily so i’m worried it won’t last long, BUT we’ve had it for a month now and it’s still going strong!it works very well, it’s small but has a nice look to it - not an eyesore or anything lol, it’s very lightweight which is also nice! it does NOT have an oscillation feature - it is stationary, but like i said it’s capable of warming our whole living room after running for only 30 minutes so i think that’s fine. love it! highly recommend!

Title: Holy hotness!
Review Content: This thing gets TOASTY in the name! Way more powerful than ANY space heater I've ever had, even the larger more expensive ones don't output a 3rd of the heat this one does. I'm mad now I bought a Honeywell too which is twice the size, and that seems like a kids toy compared. Speaking of which, probably don't let your toddlers walk around this thing, and make sure it's a good distance from anything it's pointed at! I'm loving this heater! Depending on what my electric bill looks like, I might just get 1 or 2 more of these and say fk calling the HVAC guy to fix my furnace! Cuuuuz, this definitely pumps way more heat than my central air heating unit. I've only had it running for an hour pointed AWAY from the thermostat and the temp in my living room went from 65 to 74!

Title: Warming
Review Content: It's cute warms you up but gotta be a little closer then some other heaters
Manually Corrected Review Content: It's cute warms you up but gotta be a little closer then some other heaters

Title: This little guy will run you out of the room
Review Content: This is my third one, all placed in rooms I go in the most - rest room- no more cold toilet seat - this this close by and the heat warms it in a minute, bedroom, and office - but you could move tham anywhere of course. This one is a an enormous bedroom with 12 foot ceilings, so I keep the ceiling fan on to push the heat back down, but it will warm the room in minutes and keep it warm, but not baking alive, due to the thermostat. Sometimes, it keeps running after I set it though, but there is a strong chance it could be me, not paying attention and getting in tune with it. I love them, my electric bill would be twice as high to heat an apartment this big without them. Fairly quiet, it's just rushing wind from a strong fan. One thing, DO NOT SIT ANYTHING CLOSE TO THEM AND ONLY SET THEM ON A FLAT, HEAT RESISTANT SURFACE. The heat will shoot out and rise, acting like a convection oven if anything is close, it will basically bake it, heating it up. Leaving it on 3 feet from the bathtub for 4-5 hours, I return and even the shower rod ( 7 feet off the floor ) was almost too hot to touch!! With the steam and heat, it looked like it actually dried out the ceiling in the small room, I had to touch it up and not run it so long in there. They work, make no mistake, just use common sense though. If you have ceiling fans, it really helps push the heat back down I believe too.

Title: I love this little heater
Review Content: I love this little heater! I have had it for around a month now and it has really changed my living experience. My NYC apartment offers little to no heat from the radiators, and the room itself is poorly insulated, so I was walking around my apartment with heavy winter jackets on. I finally decided to buy this heater, despite some negative reviews about its longevity and electrical issues. So far, it has held up extremely well. When I first got it, I left it on the highest heat setting (because my room was positively frigid) and it took a few hours to fully heat up my room to a comfortable level (my room being approx. 12 x 14 with 10 foot ceiling). It would likely take less time for a better-insulated or smaller room. That being said, I now leave the temperature dial to around the third or fourth setting and the heater will kick in every 20-30 minutes to keep my room at a nice temperature. When I sleep, I leave it on the second or third dial, and it maintains the temperature throughout the night so I don't have to wake up to a cold room. Although the cord does get warm if I leave it on for too long, even on the days when I had it up on the highest setting for hours, it didn't get hot enough for concern. It's plugged into a wall outlet, and is the only thing plugged in there. That being said, there have been two occasions where my roommate and I have overloaded the circuit by using our heaters concurrently, but that's a minor negative. Overall, I am impressed so far by the quality of this heater for the low price, and the absolute increase in my comfort at home. I will update if anything changes.

Title: Auto shut off and heats up a 10'x20' room to balmy
Review Content: UPDATE:I've had this little heater 10 months and pulled it out when we had a cold snap recently.  While it still does a great job heating up a room, the fan on it has gotten worse.  I get the same fan speed no matter which setting I use and the fan is a lot louder this year.  I still love the fact the box doesn't heat up much after it's been running, so I don't have to wait for it to cool down to move it to another room, but I'm looking for another unit because the fan noise is getting too loud to sleep.================================================I needed a replacement for my old space heater in the bedroom.  I use these to maintain a warmer temperature in there during the winter so I can turn the furnace down at night.  I was a bit skeptical of this one when I got it because it's extremely lightweight, so I doubted it's ability to generate sufficient heat for a 10'x20' room.  I have to admit, I've been pleasantly surprised.  I can leave the thermostat on it to the 4th setting (1/4 turn) and it keeps the room balmy when it's in the 40s outside.  When the temperature drops down to freezing, turning it up to the 6th setting still keeps the room cozy.One thing I find odd about this little heater is the fan.  For some reason the fan makes more noise when it's set to fan only, or the middle fan setting.  It sounds like it's not balanced, tbh.  However, when the fan is set to 2, the vibration levels out and the fan noise doesn't disturb my sleep.Overall, for the money, I'm very pleased with the purchase.

Title: Excellent heater, great price
Review Content: Great little heater, that can't be beat at that price!  I have used it extensively this winter to heat my bedroom.  It has done an outstanding job.  I have not had any issues with it.  It has operated exactly as described and has done a wonderful job.I bought it to replace a different small heater bought a couple years ago.  That heater was around the same price, but always felt cheap and unreliable.  I made sure to always keep it within my eye-line as I felt like it was going to catch on fire any day.  Then, one it just shorted out and stopped working.  I searched Amazon for a replacement, and considered spending more for something more reliable.  I came across this heater, in the same pricing area, and decided to take a chance.  I could not be happier with my purchase.  This device feels much better made, more sturdy, and more trustworthy.On my device, only the front grill get hot to the touch.  The top, bottom, back, and sides all remain cool to the touch even when the device has been running on high for hours.I am very happy with my purchase and would buy it again in a heartbeat.(Edit):  I did actually buy it again!  I had need for a second unit, so I made sure I ordered exactly the same device.  This would be appropriately 2-3 years apart.  The new unit looks even nicer, only slight changes to the look, but I'd say they're improvements.  Both units are running great, have never given me any trouble, and have my confidence that they're not going to suddenly catch on fire (which I can't say the same about some other brands I've owned in the past.)  So I'm still happy with this device and would recommend it.

Title: A Good Little Heater

I found the fan of the heater to be a little louder than I would like.  It is not unduly loud, just know it is not a quiet fan for the size of the unit.  Second, I did not notice an air output difference between high and low heat selection on the dial.  Overall, a good little heater for the price.

Title: Check how much power it draws
Review Content: For $32, it's a great unit. Keeps me warm at my WFH desk, without costing hardly anything.Something I never considered though was how much power it draws, and what else is on the same circuit in my home. I've got it on a 20 amp circuit, shared with my "Living Room Outlets". That means the circuit breaker trips when it hits 20 amps, but you also need to keep continuous use under 80% of the max, so 16 amps. Watts / volts = amps, so if it's running 1500 watts / 120 volts, that's 12.5 amps already. I've only run it on the lower setting, which looks like it only draws 900 watts, which is 7.5 amps. But then you add my computer and monitor (6.67 amps + 1.2 amps), and a small amount from my wifi and other tv/audio appliances, and the breaker is hitting that 80% threshold.I'm not an electrician, I barely know how this works, and clearly my computer isn't drawing that full amount all of the time or this system wouldn't work at all. But my breaker does trip 1-2 times weekly when running the heater, and my monitor takes these half second "rest breaks" during the day, probably because it's not getting enough power.TLDR: make sure you don't have anything major running on the same circuit as this heater, and you'll be just fine.

Title: Surprisingly powerful Lasko space heater
Review Content: Great Value - amazing quality and heat output. Low cost to run very efficient. Purchased one of these as an add-on for another Amazon product over 15 years ago, was in the low to mid $20. range. Tho a different model, runs exactly the same is as powerful and heats as well if not better. Also has a fan function which cools personal space nicely.Heater worked perfectly until the heating dial fell off and got lost. Had to turn with pliers and broke while twisting.Replaced with a Comfort Zone lookalike which ran from midOctober to midFeb, 4 mos and suddenly stopped working. Cold weather has lingered so decided to try this one again. Price is a bit higher $30. but still a bargain considering how long ago other one was purchased.Between high to low there are 11 settings. I estimate each to be approx 2 degrees. The lowest setting off w thermostat only on, 60ish, highest 80ish. At outside temps of 50-30 it keeps space at 63-67 running intermiitently kept on third or fourth dot, heats 1200 sq ft space which is poorly insulated and drafty. Runs well at higher temps and are are easily achieved but obviously runs more. Even when running continuously for long periods of time as backup for 0-subzero temps older model still lasted for 10-15 years. Also use small wall socket heaters set at 60 to heat drafts but those come on rarely, all together works great.

Title: Love this thing!
Review Content: I freaking love this thing!!! My house is weird where the upstairs heat, heats the bedrooms only but the thermometer gauges the open space, so since it doesn’t heat the open space, it keeps the heat on trying to increase the temp there, but the bedrooms get too hot. With this little heater, I can just keep the heat off and use this heater to warm my room to my liking then shut it off.Previous heaters I’ve had in the past turn off automatically once the heater is not standing upright, this one does not. When it tipped over, I noticed it pretty quickly so I could stand it upright, but if I had been sleeping, I’m not sure what could have happened. I recommend having a humidifier on if you use the heater in a small space since it can get very dry. The knob for the temperature control turns off the heat of the space is already at that temperature, but as far as the difference between the lowest temp and the highest, I didn’t notice it get hotter as it went higher. I did notice a difference between the level 1 heat and level 2 heat on the left knob.

Title: I bought one first to make sure I liked it, and then I bought this one. too
Review Content: The fan is just a little noisy. This is a small heater, so it has small fan. It has to turn quicker to push the right amount of air, so it has to be a little noisier than larger units. Lasko sells a bigger one, which is probably a little quieter, if that is important to you.  Everything else is fine.I am 77, and I have had several Lasko fans. They have all lasted a long time, so these will likely last a long time, too.

Title: Great Little Heater but Check for Dust Buildup
Review Content: Five years since purchase and it still powers out the heat. Doesn't oscillate so keep that in mind. No safety auto shut off; I always turn it off if leaving the room/area for any extended periods. The air is drawn in from the back and along with it (over a period of time) dust will build up on the interior filaments. After a few months of heavy use, when checking with a flashlight, some areas were completely clogged with dust. Kept an eye on it (fire hazard) and was sufficiently concerned that I eventually cleaned out the dust by using dampened long-stemmed q tips (inserted through the back slots and wiggled around). The back plate screws are deeply recessed and look to be of a shape that requires a special screwdriver or tool. Why not make it easier to maintain the appliance? Other than that, great little heater. To make it last, treat the top knob gently when turning off/on. Mine broke about 3 years in and the parts replacement cost almost 1/2 the price of a new heater.

Title: Just right for taking the chill off
Review Content: This is a nice little heater. Our kids bought one for our grandson's bedroom, so he didn't get chilled during diaper changes and bath. We were impressed enough that, when we got back home, we purchased one for our bathroom, where the radiant-floor heating sometime needs a little extra help. It's just right.Just a quick addendum: Major kudos to the company for support of its product and customers. One of the little plastic knobs broke on our heater. I reached out on Monday via Amazon and a replacement arrived already Thursday. I was prepared to pay but it was no charge.

Title: The BEST on the MARKET , HANDS DOWN .
Review Content: In all honesty this is the best little heater ive bought . I had it over a year and i use it almost 24 hours a day . I dont know what parts are in this thing but trust and believe they are TOP of the line . Why i sayy that is cause ive bought other branded heaters prior to this one nd they all broke within 2 weeks to a month no joke and the sad thing is 1 was a 150 dollar heater and after 2 weeks im not kidding if i wouldnt have been by it my house would have been on fire it was smoking and just about to catch fire and i pushed my button off on the plug strip and that was that . The point of my review is DONT pass on this little heater it worth more then the asking price and i promise you wont be needing to buy another heater .Its great and will warm up your room cause it definantly warms my studio apartment . I hope this was helpfull sorry for the long review .

Title: Powerful little heater but.. - UPDATE: Lasted 4 years
Review Content: Wow! This little thing puts out a lot of heat! It does not have anything to turn it off if it tips over, but it never claimed to. Since I only use it next to me while I work, that is not an issue. It does have a thermostat/temperature controller (that doesn't work well). I was amazed at how low I could keep the setting to feel warm. It seems quite sturdy. I am very pleased with this purchase.Edit: It lasted 4 years. It started smelling like melted plastic sometimes when I used it, and then if just wouldn't turn on at all.Looking back, it did put out a lot of heat, but I don't know that I would buy it again. It NEVER did a good job of turning off when it was hot in here or turning back on when it was cold. It was basically only two settings: ON and blasting heat or OFF. For me, it was fine to turn on or off as needed, but I certainly wouldn't trust this at night. Also, I don't think I would ever get another without the safety feature that turns it off when it tips over.

Title: very nice heater, could be easier to move around
Review Content: This heater is almost exactly what I wanted. Small, lightweight, stable base, smooth and clean design for easy dusting.The overall shape and the handle in particular aren't quite right. The reason that I wanted something small and light with a handle is so that I can quickly pick it up to relocate it as I work in different parts of the room. But the handle is just a very shallow depression in the back; my fingers only fit half-way up to the first knuckle. Because the front of the heater is heavier than the back, it's difficult to hold onto it with just four fingers in the depression, even if my thumb is on the top of the box or on the front screen. So I pretty much have to use two hands to lift it anyway. Were I to design it I would make it more square, less slippery, and either with an additional depression for the thumb or with a real handle on top.

Title: It’s Okay
Review Content: It’s okay. It gets the job done if you don’t have too big of a room or if you don’t want to be too hot. But the size of your room (of course) definitely matters on how warm it’ll feel. It works fine but the knobs do pop off easily … and it’s hard to turn the little rod that’s underneath when they do pop off. So I basically can’t turn the heater off. I have to turn it all the way on low so it “pauses” and then just unplug it. Safety wise that’s not good and it would be nice for all space heaters to have it where if it’s knocked over it turns off automatically. This one does not have that.

Title: Using in two car garage works wonders
Review Content: After reading some of the bad reviews I thought this might not be the best purchase after it already shipped and I decided to read all the reviews I have to say I'm very impressed with this I'm currently living in the garage partially finished but they're still the garage door it gets really cold out here it's been down and the twenties at night an early in the morning we have a big heater that doesn't put out much heat anymore and we needed some help since our old small heater died after a few years. I've had this heater on for a minimum of 9 hours and it's toasty warm in here in fact I doubt that there's any use for the big heater I usually have to use a heated blanket along with the heater so this was definitely a huge surprise. There was no damage to the unit it is not burnt on the sides after being on for so long I have it on setting one and it is going great the garage is a two car garage so it obviously does big area well. I highly recommend this heater!

Title: It works, good little heater AND heat settings
Review Content: Heats my room perfectly. I have it attached to a wifi controlled outlet to turn it on and off (though I unplug it completely before I leave for the day because I'm paranoid about a fire.) My room always gets pretty cold even with the heat on and this is exactly what I needed to warm my room. Heats it up noticeably in 10 or so minutes. Perfect to turn on before you get in the shower and come back to a warm room.Probably unsafe that it doesn't have some of the tip-over and auto-shutoff features of other ones but it got to me quickly and I'm satisfied with the choice (though the Amazon's Choice one I was looking at seemed a little better.)HEAT SETTINGSAs far as my testing has shown, the settings in my photo heat the room to 80 degrees (the fifth dot). The next notch down (the fourth dot) looks to heat to 75 degrees. I don't know if that means the highest setting is 110 degrees but each dot may be increments of 5 degrees going from 60 to 110.

Title: Lacks a Tip-over Safety
Review Content: I've had two of these for several months now.  This model has separate built-in thermostat control, and a high/low/fan control.  The controls work well, and the units are functioning normally despite near 24/7 use at low, and some use at high(though the thermostat does prevent continuous operation of the heating element and fan).I've not had either of mine shut off due to overheat, despite sometimes running on high for hours at a time.However, these units entirely lack a tip-over safety, and I find that alarming.  I'm not willing to test whether or not the overheat protection will engage prior to the unit setting external objects on fire, but this should not be something anyone ever has to worry about with an electric heater.  The things are dangerous enough without sufficient safety mechanisms built in.Though I'm pleased with this item overall, I would not buy it again, nor recommend anyone else buy one, for this reason alone.

Title: used about 4 months total, and no longer heat up nor fan works, but replacing with new one
Review Content: Bought this March of 2018 used about a couple months and summer came and then started to use again in November.  So the total time was about 4 months.  I don't use all day, but when i go to bathroom so average of 10 mins or less and when i take shower and get ready, maybe max 30 mins.  When i took shower few days ago and left it on for about 30 mins, it stopped working.  I see the yellow led light on, but no fan, no heater.Called the company for warranty as it should have one year protection, but was on the phone line for about 40 mins waiting, then finally left my number for them to call me back.after an hour later, i got an call and they had no issue replacing this.  So, i will get a new one in about 7-9 business days.

Title: Handle is dangerous
Review Content: Overall this heater is OK. Its heat is great. But the handle is small and slippery, when you use the handle to pick the unit up, the heater tips forward, do to its center of gravity, and then slides out of your hand.

Title: Great little heater
Review Content: It puts out a surprising amount of heat for a small unit. I like the safety features. We use it to just take the chill off a large living room on especially cold days. Using a ceiling fan for circulation it does a great job. This is the second one I have purchased and would definitely recommend it.

Title: Tiny heater, delicious warmth
Review Content: This heater is phenomenal. If you elevate it by about a foot under your desk, your legs and butt are toasty. I work in a century-old building with mediocre heating (which is often "accidentally" turned off in my office) and this thing is a life saver. My fingers and toes are no longer numb while I'm trying to work.Safety though...who knows. If it were knocked over, it would melt the rug, I'd imagine. There's no auto-shut off. The plastic casing is cool to the touch, but I have no idea what's going on inside it.  I turn it off and unplug it whenever I leave the room, and I never use it longer than 2 hours at a time. Just use common sense, don't fall asleep while using it, never leave it on when you can't monitor it. Modern space heaters are a lot safer than the glowing red hot ones in the 80s and 90s.

Title: Perfect little heater!
Review Content: I purchased two of these in October of 2018. We use one in our bedroom and one in our bathroom all winter long. Our central unit needs to be replaced so we don’t run it at all. These little heaters keep both rooms very warm on a very low setting. We set the thermostat on the low fan setting and between the first and second dot heat setting! We haven’t had any crazy expensive electric bills since using these. Our bill is actually much much higher in the summer when we run the AC. I have always left these on while we are away, at work or whatever, with no issues. Although I wouldn’t recommend doing so with them running full blast of course. If we need extra warmth, they heat the room up fast. They turn on and off like normal and aren’t crazy loud. Overall we have been very pleased especially for the price we paid!

Title: Good Heater but Not Quiet
Review Content: I was disappointed with how loud this heater was.  With working from home, I can't have this heater on during conference calls and I have to turn the volume way up to hear music or the news.  It does a good job keeping you warm if you are close enough for it to blow on you.  I made the mistake thinking the thermostat controlled how hot the air coming out was.  The thermostat actually turns the unit off when a desired temperature in the room is reached.  There are 2 temperature settings separate from the thermostat.  Overall it is a good heater for the price but buy something else if you want a quiet heater.

Title: Good heat, no handle grip
Review Content: This heater is good if all I want to do is set it in one place and leave it alone.  The indention for the holding and carrying the unit is useless.  There isn't enough room to really grab hold of it and there is no texture ( or lip) for my fingers to grip it.  I use it at my office desk and it would be nice to just pick it up with one hand and move it around.  I can't do that with this and I have dropped it several times while attempting.  As you can see I'm really frustrated with it because of this one feature - missed feature.  I haven't noticed any "safety" features, it works just fine it it falls over.  If anything, it runs too hot.  Again, I use it on the floor next to my office desk.  I can't have it too close and turning it down doesn't really make that much of a difference.  It's either too cold or too hot so I just push it away when it gets too hot.  That's why I get frustrated about the handle!

As you can see I'm really frustrated with it because of this one feature - missed feature.  I haven't noticed any "safety" features, it works just fine it it falls over.  If anything, it runs too hot.  Again, I use it on the floor next to my office desk.  I can't have it too close and turning it down doesn't really make that much of a difference.  It's either too cold or too hot so I just push it away when it gets too hot.  That's why I get frustrated about the handle!

Title: Safe, automatic shut off
Review Content: We’re keeping the heat low in the house but this keeps us toasty warm in the bedroom or tv room. It shuts off should it turn over, no worries about sleeping with it on or leaving it on while out, even with pets. I bought my first ceramic heater in 1987 they were pricier but came down quickly. I lived in a condo that had heat problems constantly and was able to leave my first one on for months at a time, heating my slightly under 1000sq ft condo warm and safe. I still have the one I first bought, this is for my boyfriend’s house. There are 2 dials one for the temperature and the other for the fan. You can set it to a number of combinations and It will shut off and on keeping you at your desired temperature.

Title: Reliable Little Space Heater
Review Content: I've been using this little space heater for 3 years, and it's still working great! I use it at work to keep my feet/legs warm. Title: Effective and easy to use
Review Content: Very effective even for larger spaces. We use this in our finished basement master bedroom, and it heats up the space very quickly. We've used this overnight and during the evening without any issues, for about a year now. Very pleased with this product.There are some reviews complaining that this item is unsafe. Please read the safety documentation that is included. Never plug a heater into an extension cord or power strip, as they are NOT designed to handle the power requirements for a heater, and can melt/catch fire. A ceramic heater is also self limiting (the elements become less effective as the temp rises). This means it will not, if kept in good working condition, burst into flames or cause other materials to catch fire. Please use common sense, pay attention to the manual that's included, and stop using if you've managed to damage it (dropped, kicked, etc).

Title: Perfect portable heater
Review Content: I have ordered a few portable heaters for myself, due to the fact that my office is over air conditioned,  and this one is by far the best.  It has 2 levels of heat,  it also has a fan only option.  It will automatically turn off when it reaches the set temp. It's sturdy, so I feel comfortable with it not easily being knocked over, and it's extremely light making it easy to transport.  I truly like that it doesn't have a strong "heat/burning" odor like other heaters I've ordered in the past. It's pretty close to being near silent and it doesn't make a sound when it's turned off. (Unlike previous heaters that I've ordered)  It's exactly as pictured,  and I love the small size.  I do not have any negatives regarding this item.

Title: I didn't notice a drastic difference in temperature but I think it did a better job at circulating the heat more quickly
Review Content: Very decent space heater. My bedroom is a converted sunroom, and the heating does not circulate well in our apartment. It's not a huge space, about 150 square feet. It does take a while for the whole room to heat up, so typically I just aim the heater towards me so that I'm getting the bulk of the heat. I've mostly used it on the low setting but on an especially cold day recently I used the high setting. I didn't notice a drastic difference in temperature but I think it did a better job at circulating the heat more quickly. Overall, it was certainly a worthwhile purchase and I no longer have to wear my winter clothes indoors!

Title: Had this thing for 4.5 years and it is still going strong.
Review Content: My room is a converted garage that is about 13ft by 15ft and I bought this in the winter of 2017 and have used it every year, reliably, since then. I've run it for days at a time and even, on the low heat setting at around 25-30% of the heat dial and this will warm the room comfortably within an hour. It doesn't turn off when it falls over though, so be aware if you have it in a spot that it may be prone to children, pets, or some other hazard.

Title: Returned
Review Content: I get very cold and was looking for something quiet and inobtrusive for my office. This wasn't it. It's like other units out there in that it only has two heat settings, except both are loud, to the point of not being able to hold a meeting in my office with it on the lowest setting. And even on the lowest setting you're getting a too-hot blast of air, I wasn't able to get it to just put a steady bit of heat out. Also I'm sure the thermostat is a safety feature but what happens instead is it's too easy to assume it's off when I don't hear it as I leave work, but later at night as the building cools off it will turn back on and run all night, not safe at all. I have purchased and tried several similar heaters on Amazon and my experience with them has been similar. I'll just go back to using my ancient little 30y old heater.

I will update if I have any problems.

Title: Quiet and Efficient
Review Content: The heater is very quiet - the fan has only one speed.  It is fairly heavy and didn't  tip over when my small dog bumped against it.  On the high setting (1,500 w), the thermostat can be set from 60 to 85 degrees.  On the low setting (1,000 w), the thermostat automatically stays on 'high'.  From five feet away, It warms the area around my desk quite well.  The heater has no safety shut off but unless it receives a fairly hard bump, it's unlikely to tip over.

Title: Heater functions well.
Review Content: I bought this heater for my grow tent. I am located in a northern state and therefore have to begin growing my more sensitive garden plants, such as tomatoes and peppers, inside and then plant them in mid to late May in my garden plot.  I start them in my basement which is a bit cool this time of year.  My plants are responding quite favorably to the heat they are now receiving thanks to this heater.  Starting my plants without the heat, which I have done in the past, leads to much slower seed sprout and plant development.  I am happy with this heater.

Title: Heats small spaces well but seems loud
Review Content: I needed this heater for my home office, that stays colder than the rest of the house.  It does the job, but it seems louder than it should be.  I definitely can't have it on when I'm doing a teleconference.  It is just as loud on the lower heat setting as it is on the higher (1500 watt) setting, just with less heat shooting out the front.  The thermostat seems to work, but I'd prefer an adjustable heat/fan speed so I could turn it down (quieter) and still get heat out of it.  It actually generates too much heat and fries my face and arms if it's on the desk.  I probably should have spent $20 more on a better unit, but it'll do for now.  You get what you pay for.

Title: A Good Space Heater For This Price Point
Review Content: It is a basic simple design that works effectively. Simple, easy to use controls, an effective safety interlock to prevent tipping accidents, and an attractive appearance. You can choose to use it in the fan only mode, or in low or high heat output. We used it to supply supplemental heat to a 130 Sq Ft. bathroom during the winter months and were delighted with it's performance. Initially, it is very quiet, especially on the low fan speed setting. Even at the high speed fan setting it is noticeable but not objectionable, After several years of service it did develop a bearing rattle, but that was not annoying enough to warrent concern. A worthwhile investment, you won't be disappointed.

Title: Works well if you know what you're using it for. It's a small indoor space heater; not a furnace.
Review Content: I will review this in the capacity in which I have used it.So far, I'm using it to keep a ~150 sq. ft. bedroom ~5-8°F warmer than the rest of the house. So far, this unit has been performing well. The tip-over safety is a spring-actuated button that is depressed by the weight of the unit. So if it falls over, the spring releases a switch somewhere and power is immediately cut. On the shelf I have the unit located, this button isn't a problem, but I will admit it makes the unit feel a little more "tippy" than one might expect. It's not very heavy, and the spring makes it feel even less so. This may be fixable by reducing the spring k-factor or centering the button more within the unit, as it's location is biased a bit toward one corner. (Note: manufacturer potential changes; I don't recommend trying to do this yourself). I don't consider this a major detriment, as you shouldn't put a heater on an unstable surface anyway, but be aware that some solid footing underneath is a good idea and keep it out of the way of potential traffic or flying objects. Again, if it does tip, the power cutoff is immediate.The thermostat seems to work well, and was the primary reason I selected this product (along with included safeties). As previously mentioned, it keeps the room it's in at a consistent 5-8°F warmer than the rest of the home when left on the partial power setting. It took some experimenting with the thermostat position, as it doesn't have temperature markings on it, but about 30-35% of full scale is where I have it set. That seems to be ~70°F control temperature for the room size and R-value. It also implies there is a fair amount of margin to run the unit harder than I am.One more thing to note is that it says right on the box, in slightly different words, that this unit is not meant to run a high duty cycle. I don't think it would work well in large rooms or in something like a hunting blind that's very drafty/open to outside. It's meant for relatively small rooms with relatively small heat losses so it doesn't have to run 100% of the time. I haven't tested the over-temperature function yet, and don't really intend to. Generally, relying on the safety limit isn't a good plan anyway.Long story short, for a smaller room that just needs warmed up a bit, this works well. It seems simple and well made, especially for the low price tag. It has some safety features not found on similarly priced models, which is a plus. It's not silent, but it's not obtrusive really either. Overall I'm satisfied with the purchase so far.

Title: Works perfect
Review Content: Pretty simple ceramic heater. I don't like running the heat in my house. If I get hot or even very warm, I can't sleep. Not a problem until you need to go to the bathroom and it feels like an icebox. We run the heat but before I go to bed, I turn the thermostats down to 68. If it gets colder than that the heat pump(s) come on. Our bathrooms have vents from the heat pump(s) in them but if it doesn't come on all night, the bathrooms are generally 2-4 degrees cooler. We have one of these in 3 different bathrooms. The bathrooms each have a stool for the women to sit on and put makeup on. If it's cold, we sit the heater on the stool, turn it on low about medium intensity and within 5 minutes (with door closed) the bathrooms are warm. I saw a minimal jump in our electric bill. I would guess we use the three for a total of 15 minutes a day. No more than $1 to $2 a month on the electric bill.Of note: These get very warm very fast. The first time I used one, I turned it on and went to the bedroom to get some clothes to put on after my shower. It took maybe 5-7 minutes. The bathroom was downright toasty. These are interesting items because they remind me of the old wall heaters in concept, if you remember those. When I was a kid everybody's house had wall heaters in the bathrooms. These work similar to those without all the corrupt, out of code wiring in the walls. Much nicer than we expected. I'll update if anything stops working. Oh and there is a tip switch for those that sit on them floor and worry about them turning over. The bathrooms are all 240-300 sq. ft and it warms the whole area including the cold sinks. I guess I should have pointed out that these are small but they work better than a bigger one we used to have. Highly recommended.

Title: Good For Supplemental Heat on Cold Days
Review Content: The Pro Breeze ceramic space heater is an economical answer but make sure it is adequate for your heating needs.It has two power settings, 750 watts and 1,500 watts.  At 1,500 watts, that produces about 5,100 BTUs of heat.  This is generally sufficient to heat a 150 square foot area with 8 foot ceilings.  If you have higher ceilings (we have 10 foot ceilings) it will be less effective.This heater is very compact, measuring 6.5” X 5” X 9”.  It has a fan which blows out the warm air in one direction.  You need to position the heater so that the warm air can spread most effectively.  It works best if you can position the heater in one corner and direct/face the heater toward the area you wish to heat.There are three settings – fan only, low heat and high heat.  The heater is equipped with an automatic shutoff if the heater tips over.  The shut off switch is a spring loaded button on the bottom of the heater.  Unless it is depressed – sitting firmly on a surface – the heater will not work.This heater puts out warm air immediately after turning on.  The effective heating range is about 3 – 4 feet directly in front of the heater.  It will eventually heat up the area but it does take a little time.Our master bathroom is the most distance from the central heating unit, so on really cold days, it gets a bit chilly in the master bath.  We use it very effectively when taking a bath/shower.This is intended to be supplemental heat and it works well.  It is a good value for the price.

Title: Excellent Solution
Review Content: My wife and I like a warm bathroom but a cool house - and, without an individual room thermostat (we have a hot air heating system) we had a problem - heat the whole house to keep the bathroom warm, or keep the whole house cool and come up with a way to heat the small bathroom - especially at night when we always turn down the central heat temperature and find ourselves using the bathroom frequently during the night.Sooooo, I did a search on Amazon for a small electric space heater that would provide instant heat while not taking up a lot of floor space.  Well, there are literally 'hundreds' of space heaters to select from - while it is great to have so many options it makes selecting one very difficult.  I searched for several days and could not make a selection for one reason or another - everything from dead on arrival to safety issues, poor construction quality, too large etc..  Finally I focused in on the Pro Breeze 1500W Mini Ceramic Space Heater - I liked the heating element, thermostat and 2 levels of heating - I also liked the simplistic design, small footprint and it just looked good.  I decided to try it because it is a small investment and I have confidence Amazon will take it back if it arrived DOA and or damaged when I get it.  OR if it simply did not heat the way it was supposed to.I have been using the Pro Breeze for a week now and am so impressed with it I have just ordered a second one for our second bathroom. I have always been reluctant to use electric space heaters, due to safety concerns, but this unit has given me confidence that I can actually leaving it on to control the temp of the bathroom even when I am not in the room.I am very happy with my selection and look forward to a winter with warm bathrooms while we keep the rest of our home at a much cooler temp.

Title: ProBreeze Electric Heater-Awesome Heater
Review Content: I buy a few Electric Ceramic Heaters a year.As they run a long time they lose some of the Heating ability as the Ceramic wears out.Usually I replace them every 18 months.I have 4 of them and keep one in each room that needs a little extra warmth.I usually buy the Lasko brand from Amazon and they are great Heaters.But wanted to try a different Heater with the safety cut off switch on the Bottom.Tried one Brand first and it was a piece of Junk.If you barely touched it that Heater would flip over.They said it would also set on Carpet and that was an out right lie.That Heater was unsafe and went into the Junk Pile after one month.So I read the reviews and bought this ProBreeze Heater.First off it does put out great Heat for sure.I always run Heaters on the low setting as I feel they are much safer that way and they still put forth a lot of Heat.Next the Safety Switch on the bottom works extremely well and cuts off immediately if knocked over or picked up.The outside feel of the Heater has a good feel to it when its picked up.It has an indention at the top backside making picking up easy to move when running a lot easier!One thing I like also is that it has a Light on the Top Front that lights up soon as its turned on and goes off when it turns off.Some Heaters have lights that stay on all the time just showing that it is plugged in only.I have let this Heater run Two days straight with no problems at all.Getting ready to buy one as a Gift and will also buy more of this Brand for my Home.As I said at the Headline this is an Awesome Heater and would recommend it very much!This Heater will set on Carpet or the Kitchen Floor Just Fine and Works Great Either Way!

Title: Small and mighty
Review Content: I live in a small 1930s home - which means no insulation.  So I keep the thermostat at a reasonable temperature which is fine for the sunny side of the house - but the back side which gets little light is always cold.  And of course, that’s where my office (smaller bedroom) and bathroom are located.  I’ve had a small black space heater that sits in my office for years - but the cord is short and there’s no where to set it so that I could easily move it between spaces without unplugging it each use or using an extension cord - which I am not sure is safe.  So I got this one designed for wet spaces and in white with a longer cord that would reach the outlet in my teeny bathroom up by the light switches.  I am pleased with the simplicity and instant heat.

So I keep the thermostat at a reasonable temperature which is fine for the sunny side of the house - but the back side which gets little light is always cold.  And of course, that’s where my office (smaller bedroom) and bathroom are located.  I’ve had a small black space heater that sits in my office for years - but the cord is short and there’s no where to set it so that I could easily move it between spaces without unplugging it each use or using an extension cord - which I am not sure is safe.  So I got this one designed for wet spaces and in white with a longer cord that would reach the outlet in my teeny bathroom up by the light switches.  I am pleased with the simplicity and instant heat.

Title: Great little heater!
Review Content: A little loud for its size, but heats up a room as advertised.
Manually Corrected Review Content: A little loud for its size, but heats up a room as advertised.

Title: Very Good Buy! I highly recommend it!!!
Review Content: I'm working from home at a computer and I get cold since I'm not moving around to stay warm. I needed a small space heater to just heat up my immediate area so I don't have to turn the thermostat up. I looked at so many before I decided on this one. It works perfectly and I'm extremely happy with my choice!!I didn't want a tiny one for my desk that only blew on my face. It's small, but not tiny so it takes up very little space.I wanted it to automatically adjust the heat so I'm not having to manually adjust it all the time. The temperature control knob really works for that. I've only needed to use the low setting since it's right next to me and it heats up my immediate space very quickly. I'm surprised how infrequently it has to run to keep me warm since I have an open floor plan and I'm in a corner of a large room. I was concerned that it was going to try to heat the whole room up, but it doesn't try to do that.Also, I wanted it to be very safe. I like that it has both overheat & anti-tip protection. The light on the front reminds me that it's on so I can unplug it when I'm done working.It came with a letter from the founder of Pro Breeze thanking me for my purchase and offering to extend my 1-year warranty to 2-years if I register my heater on their website within 7 days of my purchase. It was very easy to do that with no long survey or unrelated questions that you know they're going to use to sell your info to other companies. Only my name and email address.I've been using it for a week and I HIGHLY recommend this heater!

Title: Convenient and effective and reliable
Review Content: This little space heater is a great value for the price. I have purchased three so far to use at home and at my office. Safety device prevents it from running unless it's flat on the floor. I highly recommend this heater.

Title: Update 2021: This one does the trick!
Review Content: I bought this for my kitchen because despite our good gas heat, if I'm not cooking, it can get chilly in the kitchen during the winter. I bought this because the price was what I wanted to pay and the features were what I was looking for. I am very happy with it after one week of on and off use. I have a large kitchen with 2 doors that lead outdoors or to the garage and both areas are cold!. This heater makes it all cozy in a few minutes and I don't need to leave it on high fan nor on max heat. The plastic casing does get pretty warm, but there not been any plastic odor or anything else to make me think of overheating. So I give this a 5 star rating at least for how I use it.  EDIT: 2020 I bought a 2nd one of these. The above review still applies. No my 1st did not die, my son who has a large bedroom (actually a converted bonus room over the garage) was tired of his tower heater with remote he chose not keeping him warm and being (after all) too large. Rather than say ner ner I told ya so, I bought this second one. [EDIT Feb 2021: I had some technical issues with my 2nd fan shortly after writing this review. I have to say that ProBreeze has superior and very responsive Customer Support (ty Karen!). I am still giving this a 5 star review as I think my issue was a fluke and ProBreeze resolved it very quickly.]

Title: Good choice for small bathroom
Review Content: Trying to keep apartment heating bill low, but I like cozy bathroom for showers, etc. There are two dial controls on the top. One is for setting the desired warmth (no numbers, just a progression from small to large bars). The other dial allows for Off, Fan only, Low, and High.My preference is for moderate temperature on the heat level and low on the fan. When the room is meeting the desired setting, the heater shuts off automatically, but comes back on to maintain that level of warmth. I’m careful to turn both dials off when leaving so that it doesn’t continue to run when I’m not there. (I would include pictures, but can’t figure out how to do that from my “privacy” mode.) The fan makes a bit of general fan noise, but that’s good as a reminder to turn it off when leaving the room.I wish it had a timer to set when turning it on, so that I wouldn’t have to remember to turn it off, but that might make it more pricey, and since it is sitting on the counter in front of me, remembering hasn’t been a problem. The pressure gizmo on the bottom instantly shuts it off, if it should tip over. However, the boxy design is quite stable, unlikely to tip easily. Also would prefer a white cord, rather than black… But these are minor quibbles. It functions well for what I need.

Title: Hot 🔥 works great 👍
Review Content: Works great
Manually Corrected Review Content: Works great

Title: Lasts more than 2 winters and still going.
Review Content: I’ve had this little heater for a couple of winters so far and just ordered a 2nd one. It puts out great heat to easily heat up a room without any additional help. I use it almost everyday during winter. I’m sitting in a 20’ X 22’ room right now with just this heater and no central heat at all turned on, 42°F outside and it’s 73° inside with this heater on High (1500Watts) and probably getting hotter in here. It has been on for several hours now.  I’ve used this heater when it’s way colder outside with no issue. I use it to reduce my home heating at night and only heat up the room I’m in. The switches seem pretty tough to last a long time. The knock over kill-switch works as designed.Tips:- When shutting off the heater I first turn it from heat to the fan setting for at least 15 seconds to cool off the coils. (I believe this will prolong the life of this units coils but it may not be needed. Just something I do so the coils don’t go from scorching hot with airflow to no airflow at all.)- There’s no numbers on the temperature setting, so I would just turn it on until the room gets to the temp you want and then turn the setting down until it shuts off and leave the knob at that location or a tiny bit higher. (That being said I’ve only used that feature once)Overall well worth the money since it seems to last a long time.

Title: Didn't break once, didn't break twice
Review Content: This heater began as one of the worst products I've bought in recent memory. It stopped heating when I turned it on getting out of the shower within a week of purchase. I was convinced it was a piece of crap and that the positive reviews were bogus. I then went to move it a little on the vanity top and it sprung back on. I realized I had placed the heater such that its doohicky (aka auto turn-off switch?) was slightly elevated because the vanity top had a slight rim at its edge. It was a safety feature to cut itself off. Once it was back on the flat surface, it magically worked fine again. Within a few weeks, though, I figured my original "piece of crap" suspicion was true because it would stop & start heating every minute or two. This time it was on a flat surface, so it wasn't doohicky problems. However, I noticed that its dial for its thermostat of sorts had been turned a bit away from "full," i.e., it was again intentionally turning itself on and off.So, now I am a believer. I use it daily to heat up an otherwise cold bathroom. It heats fast, and it is fairly quiet. If there is any caution, it might be that I cannot speak to how well it works in trying to keep a very cold room warm by leaving it on all day - I haven't tried it. However, I do know I bought this heater at a good price and it has worked flawlessly when I am not an idiot.

Title: Overall a good product for the price
Review Content: The heater had an unpleasant smell and came with a warning about burning it off before use. I was concerned about my pet so I ran it in my garage. It took a lot longer than the information said, but the smell did go away. I've enjoyed the heater since. On high it does a nice job and of warming up an average sized room. In a larger space you'll really want it pointed at you. The tip over feature works really well. The screen does get warmer than I would like so use caution if you have curious pets or kids. The only thing I don't love is that the low setting is actually louder than the high setting, which makes no sense. I haven't played around a with the temperature adjustments much, I tend to just run it as high/hot as it will go and then turn it off. Overall, it's a cute compact heater that is well worth the sale price I paid.

Title: big glitch, but still a great heater
Review Content: edit to below comment:  i think i got a dud heater the first time.  not cool since it could have started a fire in my camper.  but that said it was great while it worked, quiet, small size, good heat on low setting, low dialed thermostat, good design, good tip-over feature.  reviews are still the best on amazon, and so i contacted the seller and they agreed to send me a replacement, which i am going to assume will work fine.the five things i was looking for in a heater: small size, a low setting of 750w, quiet, tip-over feature, and a thermostat that turns it on and off to keep it at the right temp.purchased 10.19.19.  today is 11.11.19.  have used this only a few times for a few minutes in less than the month i've had it.  good thing i was sitting here right next to it just now, because i smelled the hot electrical burn in time.  usually, the light goes off and the fan goes off when it turns itself off with the thermostat, but now the light was on and the heater was silent- the fan was not on, but the heating element was, and it was frying itself, very hot to the touch.pizzed off because i really researched and was willing to pay whatever for the best, most reliable small heater.  time to start all over.

Title: Faulty unit?
Review Content: This was a great heater. I have a small bedroom and it was able to bring it from 62 to 75 if I wanted it to. I ran this a couple hours a day and got it a couple months ago or less. I just turned it on now and it smells like burning plastic. I’m sooo disappointed and am going to look for a refund. I can’t use this cause I have safety concerns with my birds. They need a ceramic heater since it didn’t have Teflon. I’m really really disappointed this didn’t work out; I loved it while it lasted!Maybe I got a faulty unit, who knows.Also the temperature control is finicky. I feel like the dial isn’t accurate and even if I have it at the same place every time I turn it on, it changes the room by a few degree different from last time. This literally wouldn’t matter though and would’ve gotten 5 stars from me if it didn’t stop functioning properly :(Edit: no more smell. No idea what that was. It’s functional and still working. I really do like it!

Title: Turns itself off for safety periodically
Review Content: I was looking to replace my old small space heater that went out. My Chiweenie and I "need" it for cold nights when watching TV. I wanted something small to sit at the end of the couch on a small table pointed right at us. This seemed to fit the bill.BUT 2 things I don't like:1. It gets WAY too hot to have it that close to us. Unlike the older heater. I know this may be a good thing if you are looking for a room heater. But we weren't2. It turns itself off periodically. Which again, may be a good thing for safety, but not what we use it for. I like to have it on until I want it to turn off. Plus is makes a clicking sound when it turns off/back on which freakes my chiweenie out. She is now afraid of it. If I turn it on, she high-tails it!It definitely warms a room, it is also a fan and it has good safety features. All of this to be fair.

Title: Great heat output!

The only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is it’s a tiny bit noisy but I love it for all the other reasons. I’ve never even turned it on high as it runs so well on low I’ve never needed to. Highly recommend.

Title: Surprisingly effective heater
Review Content: I’ve had mine for a few months and replaced a much larger heater. I mostly keep it in my bathroom so I don’t freeze when I get out of the shower and this thing is INSANE with how quickly and effectively it heats up. While I bought it for the sole purpose of heating my bathroom, I did use it in other much larger areas where it obviously took longer to heat the entire space, but it did so far faster than I would’ve expected. I’ve had heaters from other better known brands since I tend to associate brand names with a sense of higher quality, and this blows them all out of the water. It’s simple to use, with two dials up top and a kill switch underneath so it will shut off if it falls. The body itself is plastic and cool even when left running for a long period of time, but the grill is metal and can get pretty hot (if you have kids you might want to consider that).All in all, I’ve been taking this little guy with me when I travel and using it as a small bathroom heater for a while now. I 100% love this thing and think it’s a great solution for small to medium spaces.

Title: It stopped working completely within a short period of time.
Review Content: Update in 2021:I bought this little heater back in 2019 and made a review with a video on it which you can still find and read below, my heater stopped working completely within the 6month time frame like it just won’t turn on anymore or functioned I made sure that my outlet port was the right port and wattage before I plugged the heater in everything was good to go, I had this heater in one of my small room during winter months where my sphynx cat hangs out, while on low heat it warm up the room very quick (it’s a small room so yeah)Mind you I don’t always leave it on all day or use it everyday it was still in newly good condition I always leave it on low heat rather than high, and I turn it off when the room hits the right temperature plus it’s pretty loud unless you don’t mind the white noise , I don’t know if there is a burnt out internal fuse or whatever I just got very unlucky with this one.Why am I making this update now a year later since my purchase ?I was cleaning out my storage room the other day and happen to find this completely useless heater sitting there waiting on the shelf to dust and thought I’d save some people’s money... I’d say save your $30 bucks and buy a better heater for that price elsewhere along with a working temperature knob.First review 2019: I got this mini heater for my room because I have a Sphynx Cat that is always cold so I thought this would be nice to have, it does get the job done and produce a good amount of heat but the only down side I didn’t like too much about this product was the temperature knob (on the left with the -/+) it didn’t really do much if you set it all the way to negative it just shuts off, I like to keep things on low setting just for safety reasons but I guess it’s whatever, another reason is that it’s still pretty loud, the noise doesn’t bother me as long as it’s sitting somewhere far I’ve had other mini heaters that’s way quieter than this. Other than that I like the fact that if this does get tipped over it will automatically shuts off my sphynx likes the warmth that this heater produces so I guess I’ll see how it goes on the long run.
Manually Corrected Title: It stopped working completely within a short period of time.
Manually Corrected Review Content: Update in 2021:I bought this little heater back in 2019 and made a review with a video on it which you can still find and read below, my heater stopped working completely within the 6month time frame like it just won’t turn on anymore or functioned I made sure that my outlet port was the right port and wattage before I plugged the heater in everything was good to go, I had this heater in one of my small room during winter months where my sphynx cat hangs out, while on low heat it warm up the room very quick (it’s a small room so yeah)Mind you I don’t always leave it on all day or use it everyday it was still in newly good condition I always leave it on low heat rather than high, and I turn it off when the room hits the right temperature plus it’s pretty loud unless you don’t mind the white noise , I don’t know if there is a burnt out internal fuse or whatever I just got very unlucky with this one.Why am I making this update now a year later since my purchase ?I was cleaning out my storage room the other day and happen to find this completely useless heater sitting there waiting on the shelf to dust and thought I’d save some people’s money... I’d say save your $30 bucks and buy a better heater for that price elsewhere along with a working temperature knob.First review 2019: I got this mini heater for my room because I have a Sphynx Cat that is always cold so I thought this would be nice to have, it does get the job done and produce a good amount of heat but the only down side I didn’t like too much about this product was the temperature knob (on the left with the -/+) it didn’t really do much if you set it all the way to negative it just shuts off, I like to keep things on low setting just for safety reasons but I guess it’s whatever, another reason is that it’s still pretty loud, the noise doesn’t bother me as long as it’s sitting somewhere far I’ve had other mini heaters that’s way quieter than this. Other than that I like the fact that if this does get tipped over it will automatically shuts off my sphynx likes the warmth that this heater produces so I guess I’ll see how it goes on the long run.

Title: It works well
Review Content: I liked the small device heater. It will be used for the half bath and it warms the space well
Manually Corrected Review Content: I liked the small device heater. It will be used for the half bath and it warms the space well

Title: Easy to use and safe
Review Content: The heater is very simple and it does what it is supposed to do without any issues. The one thing I like the most is the safety feature. If this heater is being knocked off the feet, it stops immediately with the safety button at the bottom.  I bought this mostly for use in the bathroom as needed during the cold month as wife doesn't tolerate the coldness well after shower. For those of you wondering why don't I just turn up the central heat and problem solved? Just think of it as I am the opposite of her, I can't tolerate much of the heat. With this little yet functional device, problem solved and now we have the best of two worlds. She stays warm enough in the bathroom and I am not being cooked everywhere. I've accidentally tripped over it because of the placement (not a product issue) and it seemed to be holding up very well without even a scratch. As mentioned, the safety feature is really something you will enjoy at least I really do. By the way, we also pair this heater with a Alexa plug. For those of you that are familiar with it, you will enjoy it quite a bit.

Title: A compact ceramic heater with a lot of output and with fan and temp control
Review Content: A little heater, at a moderate price, so I had no great expectations, but it turned out to be a really nice product.The heater is nicely finished in matte black with clear white range and position markings. It is quiet in operation and it broadcast a lot of heat. I use mine while watching TV when the temperature outside drops dramatically and baseboard hot water heat takes a bit to catch up.An other nice feature is a long power cord, so it is easy to plug into an outlet and have enough cord slack to place it as desired.

Title: Great little heater!
Review Content: This is my second one of these heaters.  I like mine so much that I bought a second one as a gift for an elderly friend.  I use it daily in the winter and have for the last 3 winters.  I love that it heats up instantly and has a safety button on the bottom so that any slight tilt turns it off.  It does pretty well on energy consumption too.  Its size makes it easy to fit into any space where I want to be warm.

Title: way higher watts than it says
Review Content: Keeps me warm, but the 1500W setting is more like 3000w and sets off the surge protector. The 600w is more like 1000w and works ok.  Like most heaters, the fan is loud.
Manually Corrected Title: way higher watts than it says

Title: Love, Love, Love!
Review Content: I live in a 126 yr old house. That said the bathroom does not have a heater with the overhead vent. Rather than changing the vent to a combo and possibly running into problems and not to mention the cost I purchased this little “hot box”. It is great!  I use it only in the winter and so glad I got it. I turn it on before taking a shower and by the time I get ready the bathroom is already heated. I usually put it on high but find myself turning it down. The temp control is easy and nice to have. If you move or pick up the unit it turns off but when setting down again it turns back on great feature especially in a small bathroom. I can not speak to its use in a regular room or office but I believe it is strong enough to do the job. It does get hot!  It is easy to put away. I just place it behind the bathroom door and it fits nicely between the baseboard and door due to the doorstop Perfect!  Love it, recommend it, love the reasonable price!
