Title: Powerful little heater
Review Content: Won't burn you out but for the size, does a hell of a job for a bedroom
Manually Corrected Review Content: Won't burn you out but for the size, does a hell of a job for a bedroom

Title: Almost perfect except for “high” setting
Review Content: This heater is a great size and does a good job at heating a small room. It blows out very gently and it’s pretty quiet. It’s nice being able to control the temp from low-high with the knob. However, I can only give it 3 stars because when it’s running on “high”, the temperature control knob gets dangerously hot. It heats up slowly but gets so hot I’m concerned about the plastic melting or burning my fingers. Now, this ONLY happens when it’s on high - low is fine. And high is fine for maybe 15-30 minutes before the knob starts to get hot. But if I’d noticed this earlier, I’d have returned the heater.

Title: Little, but Mighty
Review Content: I give the Pro Breeze Space Heater a 5-star review. This heater is a great option for warming up small spaces like a bedroom, home office or under a desk. The 1500W power is plenty to heat up a small to medium-sized room quickly. I really like the 3 operating modes and adjustable thermostat, which allows me to customize the temperature to my liking. The white color is sleek and modern, and it blends in well with any room decor. I also appreciate that it has a built-in overheat protection, making it safe to use. Overall, I highly recommend the Pro Breeze Space Heater for anyone looking for an efficient and effective way to warm up a small space.

Title: Close Enough
Review Content: It does what is stated. I have cats and one of them is my shadow and likes to watch what I do and mimic it. It sees me touch the thermostat and tries to do the same which is easy because the thermostat has no friction to keep it at the set temp so it can be bumped up or down with cat paws easily. Once winter sets in, I will remove the temp knob. I have it plugged into a smart power strip and turn it on/off by voice anyways so set it and done. If I get too hot or too cold I can just ask Alexa to turn it on/off.It is a little noisier than I had hoped but tolerable.I needed this because my home is smart and my smart assistant adjusts the main thermostat once I have retired for the evening, ( Vivint Smart Home ).

Title: bummer
Review Content: I actually had this same space heater in my bathroom for 2+ years, but it crapped out this winter so I bought the same one again. Anyways this one I’ve had for a month and it’s developed this annoying clicking sound when in heat mode and it turns off every few minutes (I imagine it overheats and takes a break? Idk) and clicks back on eventually. Not only is that annoying but it’s an issue because it doesn’t make noise when it turns itself off so sometimes Ieave and forget to turn the switch off since I couldn’t tell it was actually on. Pretty bummed because the version of the same one I had before worked great.

Title: Great heater for the price
Review Content: I love this little heater, it works great for my toddler’s room. It’s not hot to the touch and the safety features all work great. I love that you can set the temperature, but it’s not a very accurate setting. It’s just a dial with no numbers showing you the actual temperature. I had to use the temp on my baby monitor to fine tune it and then made a mark at the right spot (because my toddler likes to spin the dial). Even with the mark I made though, it seems very sensitive if it’s off the mark by even a small amount. My only other “complaint” is that it would be nice if you could set it so the fan part stays on even if the heat turns off just for the white noise. None of these issues are really a big deal. It’s a great heater for the price.

Title: Great Porch Heater for One Plus Dog
Review Content: For my needs, well worth buying this little thing instead of a propane fueled porch heater.  I sit on my covered porch early in the morning with my pooch.  Our zen time before the day gets going.  It's getting crisp (was about 40 degrees this a.m.) and this tiny package, on a stool about a foot from my chair, kept us toasty warm.  I plan to add the Beauty Rest heated poncho for when the snow comes.  That combination should allow me to enjoy my mornings on the covered porch with the puppy through the winter.  Not for a crowd, it heats only a small zone outdoors.  Please also note the instructions say not to use it outdoors (or in a bathroom, which everyone else seems to do).  It's built well, and because it can't get wet on my large covered porch, I will use it out there anyway.  Bravo.  Very happy with this.  It puts out a LOT of heat.

Title: Seeing the operating instructions in advance would have helped me make a better purchasing decision.
Review Content: This space heater is small, attractive, and puts out a lot of heat. Had I had access to the operating instructions in advance, I probably would have avoided buying this heater. My house is a small ranch, and, in my opinion, lacks a sufficient number of electrical outlets. I found the list of ways not to use this appliance to be very daunting. For instance: do not plug the heater into a surge protector and do not plug anything else into the outlet in which you have plugged in the heater. There are about 10 prohibitions in this list. Nothing like this list came with the instructions for the last space heater that I purchased. In order to use the space heater I have had to unplug a lamp from the same outlet. Obviously, this would not be a problem for individuals who have outlets located every 3 feet along every wall.

Title: Good, but safety feature broke several months in
Review Content: This is a good heater. It gives off a good amount of heat quickly. The little safety foot on the bottom (which is pressed when the heater is placed on a stable surface, and turns the heater off when the foot is unpressed) was a little bit too touchy - sometimes it turned the heater off even when it was on a stable surface (maybe because our floor is a little uneven), which was a pain. After several months of use, the foot broke - it lost its springiness, and it no longer turns the heater off when it's unpressed, so we no longer have the safety feature. And the foot simply stopped working on its own. We hadn't dropped the heater or played around with the foot. Apart from that problem (which is indeed a safety concern), it's a good heater.

Title: Efficient Little Heater
Review Content: Boy, does this heater get nice and hot - and FAST!  In the summer, my bathroom gets very cold - like 58 degrees!  There are no windows, and it's entirely made of tile, plus there's an a/c vent in the ceiling.  The room  is very small. and within 5 minutes it gets nice and toasty.  I'm very satisfied.  The one criticism I have, is that the thermostat is pretty much useless.  It seems to have just 2 settings: very hot, and very VERY hot!  This is not an issue for me, but if you're looking for something that will maintain a specific temperature, you may have to pay a little more, and get a higher quality heater.  In my opinion, you can't beat it for the price.

Title: Good enough heater, but poor thermostat - do not recommend trusting it to run without supervision.
Review Content: I bought this to keep a small greenhouse around 55% F--the automatic vent opener pops at about 60.  After having it in place for over a week through variable temperatures I have been unable to find a setting that keeps it anywhere near this point. I have to continually visit the greenhouse to adjust the heat up or down, defeating my purpose of buying a heater with a thermostat.  Dreading our electric bill because it runs when the greenhouse is hot and the vent is wide open, yet it often fails to keep the greenhouse adequately warm at night.  On the bright side it heats well when it runs, seems well made and feels safe to use, stopping readily if tipped even a little.  Would be fine for extra heat when you're using a specific area and turned off once you're done, but don't depend on the "thermostat".

Title: True temperature control in a compact package.
Review Content: I have tried several small space heaters in the past and all had "issues" didn't put out enough heat, no true temperature control,  and I guess they had a safety control, if turing itself off but then only coming back on hours later.  The Pro Breeze didn't any of these and I tested it just to make sure it wasn't a get what you pay for kinda thing.  I set the temp once that temp was achieved it turned itself off, then once the cold started creeping in it clicked right back on in a matter of minutes. Turns off when moving without that heart stopping buzzer that get with other heaters. A+ Pro Breeze!Review Update: Today April 4th 9 months after turning on the Pro Breeze heater we noticed a burning smell and now it doesn't work at all. Nothing seems to visibly wrong on the outside, vents are clean. I am tempted to open it up, but will adhere to the warnings.  It was great while it lasted.

Title: It worked in a tent!
Review Content: Before using, I followed the directions and let the heater run for 2 hours on high mode to remove any smell that might emit from the heater.Took this to camping with a site that had electricity & water hookup. The camp site was right off the Puget Sound which gets very cold. This little heater worked great on a 11ft x 9ft tent. It was on High mode the entire night through the early mornings. I had it propped on a sturdy low table and made sure it is away from any flammable surface. It made the tent so much cozier, I don’t think I will ever camp without it.When using this in a tent, my advise is to make sure you read & follow directions and most importantly, it is placed safely away from walls of your tent.

Title: Great heat in a tiny, affordable package. Thermostat is inconsistent.
Review Content: Bought this to heat a small room and to use occasionally in a micro motorhome.I like the simple clean design, and the heat output is terrific. I’ve no doubt that it’s able to do close to 1500w, and you wouldn’t want more power output from a standard household outlet. Lot of bang for the buck.My only beef is that the thermostat function is very, very iffy. First, there are no numbers indicating the desired temp (60/65/70), so you’re always guessing. Secondly, it cannot seem to “hold” the desired temp, in any size room, throughout the course of a day; it’ll come on when it should stay off or vice versa. (Part of me wonders if the “thermostat” is really just a duty-cycle-gizmo that tells it to blow heat more frequently or less frequently, which is unfortunate.)

Title: Noisy, rattles, dial backwards, but heats quick
Review Content: Got this for truck camping (bed camper) when I have access to power in the winter.  Great small size, fits right in my sliding window with access to fresh air.  And good heat output; had to turn it off after about an hour because it was too warm in the camper (I adjusted the "auto shut-off" dial super low, but it seemed that was more to prevent overheating and not a true thermostat since it got to like 80 degrees in there).  That being said, the thing rattles a little, making sleep near impossible for me, a light sleeper.  And the dial seems to be backwards.  When set to "fan" it blows the hardest, in "low" it's blowing a little less (but with heat, since coils are on), and in the "high" setting, the fan is blowing the slowest (albeit, also with heat).  So I guess since it's moving less air across the coils, it gets hotter(??).  Either way, a little strange.  I wouldn't so much care, except for the rattle.  Probably wouldn't buy again, but nice to have in a pinch for those arctic nights passing through the KOA.

Title: Low-cost heater does the job
Review Content: Compact heater. Puts our as much heat as you can get from the power consumed. (Don't believe the claims by other manufacturers about how much more efficient their electric heater is....all electric heaters get 95%+ of the heat you can get per watt of power consumed). This heater has a OFF-FAN ONLY-LOW HEAT-HIGH HEAT switch, along with an uncalibrated temperature thermostat. Once you find the correct setting of the thermostat, it seems to maintain the temperature fairly well. Has safety switch to shut off the heater if it's not upright. I would call it moderately noisy in operation. Mine lasted 4 years before it failed to work.

Title: Safe and effective. Excellent heat, esp for the price
Review Content: Context: I’m using this in a 6ft x 6ft bathroom; set on the floor away from water sourceHeater’s great: even at the lowest setting, it heats up my bathroom very quickly and efficiently. Thermostat does a great job of keeping a pretty consistent temperature. It’s also fairly quiet (It generates some white noise that’s easily bearable in the bedroom or small office). I also like that it has a really simple but effective safety feature that stops the heater when toppled.I can’t comment on the longevity since I’ve only just got it. Assuming it holds up, this is a remarkably good purchase for my needs.The only thing I wish could be improved, was if the thermostat knob setting had some of indication of the temperature it’s set at. It’s currently just one of those arbitrary knob scale, so you really gotta experiment around to get your desired temperate. But that’s a really tiny comment, and something I’ve gotten over pretty quickly.

Title: It gives off little heat.
Review Content: It gives off little heat, much less than others I’ve bought of similar size and power.
Manually Corrected Review Content: It gives off little heat, much less than others I’ve bought of similar size and power.

Title: A nice compact heater--but the front grill gets hot!
Review Content: This space-saving heater has the necessary basic features, heats up quickly and appears to be well made. The large control knobs are easy to use. The high speed fan is a bit noisy but it distributes the heat well. Vibration is minimal. The front grill does get too hot to touch, even at the "low" (750 watt) heat setting, which is typical for a high-powered mini-heater.  This is an obvious safety issue if you have children or pets. I like this inexpensive, unobtrusive heater but have deducted 1 star for the fan noise and hot front grill. It's a good choice for warming up a small space where no infants or small children are present.Also note that the manual advises that you keep the heater away from water and other liquids. It's not designed to be used in bathrooms.

Title: stopped working after about 4 uses
Review Content: DO NOT waste your money! I got the first one (in a BAG! the box it came in wasn't in another box...just a thin bag) it had something rolling around in it, but I couldn't see anything and thought it was maybe the safety switch? NOPE. Heater worked MAYBE 4 times then it just died. Amazon swapped it out for another heater (the same one) this one again, came in a thin bag! This one didn't have any rattling in it, but it would ONLY work on high! You could NOT adjust the thermostat nor lower the fan level. It loud too. Only thing that did work on the second one was the safety shut off. Don't buy this brand...I'm not the only person who's had the exact same issue with this particular brand/type of heater.

Title: Portable, Safe, great Heat source
Review Content: I bought my first Pro Breeze in 2020 and carried it from room to room instead of heating the whole house. Pro Breeze has literally saved me hundreds of dollars in the meantime. I purchased a second Pro Breeze for convenience and love it. The safety feature switches heater off if tipped over. Highly recommend.

Title: A good heater... not for the bedroom (too noisy)
Review Content: I like the size, the safety features, and that it has Fan, Low, and Hi settings.However, what I really do not like is the noise.  I had it for a while in my bedroom and it just did not let us sleep every time it cycled Off/On with its thermostat. The fan is turned Off/On by the thermostat, not like others I have that the fan is always On regardless if it is heating or not.I moved it to my bathroom and brought the one I had there, another brand, to the bedroom and problem solved.I imagine that this model is too noisy for TV rooms and other rooms where you need to either rest or concentrate on what you are doing.

Review Content: I bought this heater for my friend , her bedroom is 12 by 14 feet 8 foot high ceilings , no other heat source, minimum insulation , ,  on a cold Florida night (lol 45 degrees ). Title: Good for about a year.
Review Content: I bought 3 of these for our bathrooms in winter as these rooms are farthest from the furnace/coldest. On one unit, the screws securing the fan loosened up so bad I had to take it apart (fairly easy to do) and tighten the screws. However, on another of the units, the fan motor burned up & no longer turns. These heaters are okay but will not last very long.EDIT: I have formal electronics training. Do not attempt to open up this device or any other if you are untrained in electronics and do not work on any appliances while they are plugged into electrical power. If you don’t know what you’re doing, you can easily hurt/kill yourself, start a fire, or both.

Title: Great Little Heater
Review Content: I received this new heater so I can keep my water lines water and get frozen during a freeze cold weather at my water well tanks and filters.  It has work great so far.  Glad that I have this little heater.  The settings on it is great.

Title: A Great Little Space Heater
Review Content: This a great little space heater that gives off a lot of heat on the high setting.  It is very attractive, light weight and easy to pick up and move around.  Its compact size is perfect and despite some of the reviews about it being noisy, I don't think so at all.  All my previous space heaters have been noisier.  I have an issue with the thermostat - it is not very sensitive to change of temperature.  The other problem is that when the fan goes off, the light on the unit goes off as well.  I would recommend the light stay on whenever the heater is turned on.  In that way, you don't walk away thinking the unit is off, when in reality you never turned it off.  But all in all, a great little heater.  I highly recommend it.

Title: Win some, loose some.
Review Content: This heater is a great compact heater and feels well made. The first few days we had this heater it got down to freezing outside and expected it to last over night. The heater turned off as off the internal thermostat reached optimal temp so I didn't think anything of it. It started getting colder and colder so I went to check on the heater. It would not switch on between any of the three settings. We tried other plugs in the house and maneuvering the tip switch in small adjustments but nothing worked. Called Amazon, emailed manufacturer, and they sent a new one out within 24 hours. I got the new unit in 2 days. They have great customer service. Very happy with new unit.

Title: Best one yet.
Review Content: My last 1500 watt personal heater finally went belly-up on my after 6 years. While it did service me well I didn't know what real heat output I could expect from one of these small units until I turned on this Pro-Breeze unit. I had to take it off of the High setting and put it on Low. But that wasn't enough. I had to keep dialing back the temperature control to just about halfway to off. This thing really cranks out the heat. Since I have it on the floor the controls, which are set on top, are easy to see and easy to reach. Plus it has a dead-man switch on the bottom of the unit that automatically shuts off the heater should it get knocked over. I am very pleased with this purchase. If this thing lasts me the 6 years that my old one did, I will will be extremely pleased.

Title: Died after 6 weeks - but company replaced it
Review Content: 3/24/19 update. After posting the original review on 2/17/19, customer service posted a reply for me to follow up with them directly. I did so, and they offered to send me a free replacement unit. I received the replacement unit on 3/8/19. So far the replacement unit is working well. I' updating the score from 1 star to 4 stars.We bought this space heater for $30, and received it 12/31/18. At first it worked well for our needs. We used it in the bathroom and in the kids bedrooms, and it did the job. Then after six weeks, on 2/16/19, it completely stopped working. We basically rented it for $5/week. The return window closed after only 4 weeks. I guess we got one of the defective ones. Buyer beware.

Title: A mighty little workhorse of a heater that gets the job done!
Review Content: Bathrooms are generally poorly designed for air circulation. Ceramic tile, porcelain and cast iron are often very cold surfaces and not everyone has a heated floor. The combination ventilator, light and heater units that are often found in market houses or D-I-Y renovations just don't do the job that this mini ceramic heater does. The mini heater is a real workhorse and does a great job warming up a room. Yes, the fan is a little noisy BUT that noise serves a purpose and that is letting you know it is plugged in and turned on and running. I recommend this heater but please make sure you follow directions AND plug it into a dedicated outlet otherwise you will trip your circuit breaker and get upset. I bought mine with confidence and I am sure glad I did. I also registered the purchase and got a two year warranty.

Title: Excellent in all aspects
Review Content: Not much not to like about this compact heater.  It's compact, quiet and throws out plenty of heat for its size.  I use it in both a motor home and also in a small home office.  It has two heat settings and also a fan only setting.

Title: Wish the power light stayed on all the time the power is on.
Review Content: Puts out a lot of heat for its size. It's a bit louder than I would have expected from the reviews, but not a deal killer. One feature my old heater had concerns the LED power light. On this one the LED only lights when the heater or fan is actually running. I much prefer an LED that lets you know the heater power is "on" even if it's not running. That way when you leave the house you can easily see if the unit is powered on even though it's not cold enough for the heater to come on. With this device you have to go over to it to be sure it's turned off if leaving the house.

Title: It works well for a small room
Review Content: I like this heaters size and output. I bought it for my small bathroom. I use it well away from any water sitting on a tile floor away from a wall. This bathroom just doesn't heat well with the house furnace for some reason., so I use it during the winter season. I've never had to turn it on high for heat or fan speed. It heats the small area quickly  and efficiently making taking a shower in that room far more pleasant. It turns off immediately if it is slightly tipped. (I did that once on purpose to test it) The fan and heat controls are separate. You also can use it just as a small fan.

Title: fantastic customer service
Review Content: wow- I am very impressed. Title: Great little and powerful machine at a great price!
Review Content: This is a fairly quiet and relatively compact heater. We ordered the one in white and it’s also not bad to look at.  The two dials are easy to read and functional. The fan, low and high settings work well and are predictable. The tip-over safety switch is a really nice feature and is just sensitive enough- no problems on a carpet or rug with padding (and it doesn’t turn all the way off if it tips over, but cuts the power to it instead i.e. you don’t actually have to turn it back on again. Just upright it and it starts chooching again). The heat it throws off is pretty impressive. We use it on our 3 season porch (about 8’x18’) and it does the job just fine. I would definitely recommend it. And you can’t beat the price for such a fine, well built machine.

Title: Great little heater
Review Content: I bought this little heater almost a year and a half ago. Some of the reviews said that it didn't heat their room enough. I'm not sure what they were trying to heat but I have an 11x14 bathroom and it heats it perfectly. We actually lost heat yesterday and as I was concerned about pipes freezing I turned it on. When I went back into the bathroom several hours later it was so hot I had to turn the temperature down. You also don't have to worry about it tipping over and burning anything. The second it's not completely flat on the ground it turns itself off. I would recommend this heater to anyone and would definitely buy it again.

Title: Tiny heater/white noise machine
Review Content: Okay it’s my fault for not realizing this is a MINI heater. That’s what I get for shopping in bed while I fall asleep. That being said, it’s a great heater to keep at your feet, under your desk, or to heat a smaller room (with the door closed for about an hour). It is super loud for being as small as it is, but I don’t mind the white noise while I write. The temperature control and safety features work well. Be careful moving it after it’s been on- stays hot for a while and you’ll get burned if you’re clumsy like me. For the money, it’s good.

Title: Very effective and an excellent value!
Review Content: I first bought one of these units for my daughter's bedroom, which doesn't receive the same airflow from our furnace as our other bedrooms.  She loved it so much that she took it back to college with her after winter break.  So then I ordered another one, which I ended up using in my office as I worked.  I enjoyed the ability to heat up the space quickly without needing to turn up the heat in the whole house.  Then as Chicago was expecting a cold snap, I ordered three more units and used them in my basement area, which tends to stay cooler than the rest of the house.These units are very well made and have excellent air flow for such a small device.  Additionally, they turn off immediately when even jarred or moved the tiniest bit - a reassuring safety feature.  I highly recommend this product.

Title: update - 3 months
Review Content: February 2022Well, things have changed.  One of my two is now making a horrible squeal when I turn it on and doesn't seem to want to give any heat.  AND, I don't know what I was thinking on the original review, BUT these are not CERAMIC ...they are PLASTIC... although that's not an issue at this point.  Then the next day I turned it on and it didn't moan or groan at me, so it's heating up my area again.  NOT SURE HOW LONG THESE WILL LAST.  I changed my star rating from 5 to 2 for the pending issue.  Only time will tell how long it will really work.  Not sure about having a second one now, as I haven't needed to use it yet.  Reckon I better break it out of the box and check it out.  Past the return window, of course, so either way I'm stuck with them.November, 2021Works great.  Love the ceramic.  Sturdy.  Affordable.  Like the white color vs my old "black metal" color.  It heats up a good area in my entry/kitchen/hallway just on low.  Hope it lasts as long as my old one.  Glad I got two of them.

AND, I don't know what I was thinking on the original review, BUT these are not CERAMIC ...they are PLASTIC... although that's not an issue at this point.  Then the next day I turned it on and it didn't moan or groan at me, so it's heating up my area again.  NOT SURE HOW LONG THESE WILL LAST.  I changed my star rating from 5 to 2 for the pending issue.  Only time will tell how long it will really work.  Not sure about having a second one now, as I haven't needed to use it yet.  Reckon I better break it out of the box and check it out.  Past the return window, of course, so either way I'm stuck with them.November, 2021Works great.  Love the ceramic.  Sturdy.  Affordable.  Like the white color vs my old "black metal" color.  It heats up a good area in my entry/kitchen/hallway just on low.  Hope it lasts as long as my old one.  Glad I got two of them.

Title: So far, so good
Review Content: I recently moved into a 500 sq foot apartment with older wall heaters. The space is well insulated, inside temperature has been fairly stable, so I chose this heater as something I could use to efficiently bring the temperature up 2- 5 degrees on an occasional basis. So far it is fine for that purpose, but this will be my first winter here so I can't predict whether that will hold true in the coldest months. The body of the heater remains cool when running, fan output meets my needs. I mostly run it on low as it seems to cycle more if on high. Still experimenting with relationship between temp control and low vs high output.

Title: Works Well On Small Area
Review Content: My wife set up a “Gift Wrapping Station” in our garage for Christmas.  Yes, she takes gift giving to the limit and we have 4 adult sons with families.  She set up the heater on another table beside her work area and it worked perfectly.  It kept an area about 5’x5’ in a comfortable level when the temperature ranged from 52 to 65 degrees. Price was right and it met expectations.

Title: Simple and effective
Review Content: I bought this heater for my young daughter to use in the bathroom. It is small, and the controls are easy to use. The one it replaced could be left on a constant heat, and she would forget to turn it off. This one does not have this issue. Also, the old one had push buttons that were beginning to wear out. The rotary dials on this unit will be much less prone to failure. The tip over safety feature is very sensitive, which is a good thing. It cuts off the power with very little movement, and resets just a easily. Others have said the unit is noisy. It is no more noisy than any other device of this nature. Fact is, I don't think it is noisy at all. Overall I am satisfied with the features and the price.

Title: Safe and Cost Effective Way to Save Money when RV’ing
Review Content: This is a simple review. We purchased this heater to help save a little money and provide a quieter source of heat when we were out camping while using our 30 AMP service. This heater does an outstanding job of heating our 30 foot camper in temperatures down to about 30F. Anything below 30, I would say that this heater would have a difficult time keeping up. This product seems to be safe staying relatively cool to the touch, aside from the heating element in the screen protecting it. You still need to be careful not to put any combustibles in close proximity. I cannot say how well this would work in an office or other small room, but if you are looking for a simple and easy solution to save some money during cold spring or fall camping, I would say this is a great solution.

Title: I got tired of buying the cheaper $19 throw away heaters that can burn up and become a fire hazard
Review Content: I bought two of these heaters because of the 5 star reviews that they got on Amazon. The cheap $19 throw away heaters that I had been buying from a popular home improvement store all break and wear out quickly with their underrated light duty thermostats and the flimsy off/on switches contacts burning up after a season or two.I have used this heater for a couple of weeks now and it works just fine. It isn't as noisy as I had anticipated from reading some of the reviews. The switches seem pretty stout and do not heat up (because of poor contact/resistance) and I checked these with my thermal camera and they stay cooler than most.No complaints at all and I'm satisfied with the product and the seller.

Title: You've tried the rest, now try the best
Review Content: Amazon offers dozens and dozens of small space heaters geared toward knocking off the chill in a small space.  The problem is that most of these small space heaters have small fans that run at higher RPM and produce a significant amount of sound and don't really move much air, so you get noise and it is very warm close to the heater, but still cold only a couple feet away.  In addition, most are not heat selectable, so they draw a large amount of current that can't be adjusted and in the office setting, you may not have enough current to run a 1000W-1500W space heater.  If that happens, then you'll trip the electrical breaker for your office and maybe a few adjoining ones.  Then you'll have the facilities people on your butt for having an unapproved electrical device.I drew the unlucky straw of getting the office at work with the cold air return for HVAC in it, so my office is cold all winter long.  So cold that it's referred to as The Beer Fridge.  Then in the summer, it turns into an oven.In desperation I bought one of the typical inexpensive heaters that drew 1250W and put it under my desk.  It was very warm under my desk, but took a very long time to make the office comfortable.  In addition, one cooler morning a coworker in the next office turned on a space heater also and it popped the breaker for 4 offices.  We were not very popular as the Facilities person was in a different building that morning and it took a couple hours until we had power in our offices again.So, time to look for a better space heater that had an adjustable heat setting and would move air better.  Something that was more fan than toaster oven. That is what the Vornado VH202 is.  It really moves a much larger quantity of air and it is quiet.  It is more a fan with a heating element than a space heater.  It is selectable for 375W or 750W, so I can avoid run-ins with Facilities and warms the whole office up instead of just creating a hot-spot under my desk.  As and added bonus, you can also run it in fan-only mode for those warmer days.The only thing missing in this model is a thermostat that some space heaters have.  Not a big thing for me as I never leave it running when not in my office, but if that feature is important to you, then look at some of Vornado's higher-end models.  Some even come with remotes and timers.

Title: 750 watt maximum setting prevents huge energy bills
Review Content: Nice heater, lovely stable design, takes the chill off at a very low wattage.  My priority was finding a heater that had a maximum of 750 watts but still worked for a smaller room okay. I notice that when I or guests use a space heater we automatically turn it on to the highest 1500 watt setting and then always forget to turn it lower when the room is warm. That's a huge energy bill increase if you forget about it.  I tried the smaller 500 watt Amazon Basics heater-- nice abut it was just a little too low-- I wanted to feel the heat when I entered my room as a signal that the heat was on.  This one does the job.  In small bedrooms or offices you just put it where the warm air blows toward you if you are working. When I open the door to the room, it feels warmer.  No, it does not heat the "bones" of the room and you can't get a room really hot with it, but it lets me work in my very poorly insulated study room with two walls of ancient drafty 1935 windows. When you walk in the room, you can feel the warm air.  This is meant to be used when you are near it and turned off when you're not, in my opinion. Good value for money.

Title: Good, but I needed something stronger.
Review Content: I’m giving this four stars because it’s a good product for its price, but it wasn’t enough for my 80 sq. ft. office. It’s super quiet and offers lower power usage than other heaters, but it’s also a small fan.I ended up upgrading to the MVH model, which is really just a big brother version of the VH202. At 750 watts, its lowest setting already felt warmer than the high setting of the VH202, which is also 750 watts. I think it heats better  from the bigger heating element and fan.Overall, the Vornado is a good brand to stick with, but just make sure you get the right model for your space.

Title: Second Update: VH202 heater is failing... again.
Review Content: Second update: The new Vornado heater is already making a clicking noise.  I'm not sure what is going on with Vornado's quality control but the VH202 has a ridiculous rate of failure.  How can a heater that sits on my desk and is never moved fail so many times?Update: I contacted Vornado about the issue and they sent me a brand new VH202.  Vornado's customer service really seems to take care of their customers.  However, I admit I would have liked the originally purchased product to last longer.  It only took a few business days for the heater to arrive.  It is currently sitting on my desk and working perfectly.Thanks Vornado!------This is the third Vornado VH202 heater I have purchased.  The first one died after 3 years, the second is great and my wife uses it often.  However, the third one which sits on my desk and never moves has developed issues.  The fan blades used to spin around without touching anything inside the case.  Now when I turn the heater on, the fan blades scrape the front grill and make a terrible noise.  Sometimes after startup the noise goes away.  I guess the blades balance out and move away from the grill.  However, sometimes the fan blades continue to make noise until I shut down and power back on.I have owned a combination of six Vornado fans/heaters over the last 4 - 5 years.  A year ago, a standing heater unit's cord got so hot the plug melted a bit.  Now this desktop one is having issues, different issues but issues none the less.  I hope Vornado ups the quality of their products as it seems like more and more products are having issues.

Title: Still stinks
Review Content: Been burning off the stench running it on high for the last two days. It has been six or seven hours so far. Eventually the stink will burn off but this one takes a while.No thermostat so temp heating or use a line timer of some sort.Maybe turn it into a cheap Kotatsu.Burning stench is important if you have birds like I do.Another day and it still stinks. I wiped the case with Vinegar hoping it would kill the smell. No luck.I can not tell if it is the case itself or something internal. I am fairly certain it is not the heating element.Normally plastic related stench disappears after a day or two, the other version was just a few hours.But definitely NOT the smell of anything burning.11/7 and it still stinks. The casing or something inside stinks of bad plastic. Heat didn't remove it, time didn't remove it. How does it still stink?It works but the stench refuses to leave. Leave it in the sun? Sit it outside?I wiped it down, burned it on both settings and ran it on fan. Noting works I did not know plastic could stink this long.Other than that it didn't catch fire and the cord didn't get hot and it has a fan.Maybe  next summer the stink will be gone.

Title: Best little low wattage  heater ever!
Review Content: I got this heater because my house has a ridiculously small amount of breakers and no central heating, so in the winter we’re trying to keep the place warm and not have go outside to reset the breakers because too many heaters, etc were on at once. I have a tall 1500 watt heater that I’ve had for years, and got this little 350/750 watt heater as a supplemental one. I use both to warm up my room in the morning, and then mainly keep this one on throughout the day as maintenance. I like how small but mighty it is, and that it doesn’t make a lot of background noise (I have to turn the other tall one off for work calls - too noisy). I’m very pleased with it so far, and I also like that it’s small enough to put into a cube storage bin at the end of the day so it doesn't have to sit out all the time.

Title: love this little heater but be cautious when purchasing from amazon
Review Content: I love this heater I have purchased 4 over the years but the 3rd most recently I received from Amazon I plugged in, and it shook violently and loudly (while the others were nearly silent) and it was hot to the touch.  then a black piece came out the side of it.  It was quite terrifying actually the way it slid out I thought it was something living but once it was out, I could see it was just a piece of the heater, black and slick (possibly a piece of the fan).  I contacted Amazon and they told me to send the heater back. To me this was the worst part because I didn't know if someone else would receive the same heater once it was returned to the warehouse (once you throw away the extra part it looks normal, unless you plug it in) possibly catching some unsuspecting person's house on fire!  However, in previous years, my previous vornados have made cool days so much more bearable for my always cold self in a houseful of always hot people that I couldn't bare to go without another, so I tried one more order.  The 4th order was the charm.  It arrived undamaged.  I contacted the company who informed me the previous heater could have only been damaged in such a way if it had been dropped from a very high place onto a very high surface (like in a warehouse), so we all know what happened there, this one is protected by the manufacture's warranty after the first 30 days. I wish I knew that before when I wasted my money on Asurion insurance which Amazon refused to transfer to the new heater nor use to cover the old.

It was quite terrifying actually the way it slid out I thought it was something living but once it was out, I could see it was just a piece of the heater, black and slick (possibly a piece of the fan).  I contacted Amazon and they told me to send the heater back. Title: Just not enought heat
Review Content: Purchased this for our storage bay in our large 5th wheel RV. We winter in Guntersville Alabama and have had a cold winter. Our wet Bay is joined with our storage bay so I put this in there to keep things toasty and unfrozen. It's a small space... Maybe 8'ish wide, 3' tall, and 4' wide roughly. We have good rubber seals on all our doors but this heater just couldn't keep it warm. Just the morning of this review it was 12° out and we had to turn on our propane furnace to add additional heat to the bay. For what it's worth we have 3 other Vornado heaters that keep things toasty inside our RV. Without any additional heat sources... I guess storage bays just aren't insulated like the living spaces are. Will be returning this little Vornado for a larger 1500 watt one in hopes itakes a difference. 1 last note... The safety features on the Vornado heaters are 2nd to no one! Cool touch housing, shut off it something drops on it like a shirt or blanket and tip over protection and the main reason I've been a loyal fan for several years now!

Title: Partial failure. Safety kicked in.
Review Content: A lot of Vornado products use electronic switches. Meaning if it loses power even for a brief moment, it will not turn back on with the power. Got to hit a button.Not this one!!! Turns on and off with the power. It has mechanical switches on the unit. a solid On/Off switch. this allows me to use external devices to turn it ON and OFF automatically with other things.Now for the Issue...When I got this unit, all worked fine. However High heat had a slightly off smell to it. but it was not particularly bad, and it did not seem to get worse...couple days later I found the heater off- off when it was supposed to be on. The safety features had shut it off!I turned it off and let it rest, and tried to turn it on again, see how the safety trips. To which I immediately got the smell of burning plastic. And it turning itself off within a few seconds.I tried again, but on LOW heat. the smell did not occur, and it has not had issues with LOW heat for a long while now.In essence, the High heat has failed and trips the safety features. Low heat works just fine.Although I had rarely used the High heat, it was still nice when I needed it. Otherwise Low heat is just fine for my uses.I'm satisfied enough that the Safety kicked in and most likely prevented something much worse from happening.

Title: Very small heater, perfect for cold feet at a desk! And Reynaud's!
Review Content: Safety features work INSTANTLY if the base isn't on the floor solidly. If you pick it up to change settings, this will happen so fast you could almost be startled. Now that is a great safety design!Vornado is a great brand.  I never regret Vornado purchases, and they alway know how to disperse the air... be it for humidifier, fan, or heater. [I own one of each!] This little heater puts the perfect amount of heat out for just one pair of feet!  [If you want to heat a room, they have other models.]I use this in my 2nd floor home office in a 100-year-old house.  Science says hot air rises, but my old home hasn't been notified, and it gets quite cold in the winter in my office.Now, I keep a sweater on my chair and this heater by my feet.  I am now able to work cozy upstairs instead of dragging my laptop elsewhere in the house.  [I also got a little electric throw blanket in a basket as backup! :) ]Tip: Go into a cold area with feet warm already and you'll stay cozy with a heater.  It's harder to warm up already cold feet. :) Especially if you have Reynaud's.

Title: I love this heater
Review Content: I love this heater, but unfortunately after 8 months of use it has started grinding when it starts up. Sounds like the blades are hitting to housing on the inside. Each time I use it the grinding continues longer and longer, and right now it's up to about 30-45 seconds before it seems to balance itself out. I looked up their warranty info on the Vornado website and it seems their warranty process is a bit cumbersome...I'm not looking forward to having to box it up and ship it away for warranty work & wait 2-3 weeks for it to come back - that's just a serious pain in the neck, especially since I use this heater daily.*** UPDATE 10/10/2018 *** Added an additional star for efficient warranty replacement & great customer service ****I filled out a warranty request on the Vornado website and immediately received an email back from a real person, who let me know that all I needed to do was cut off the cord of my existing unit and email her a photo of that and a photo of the serial number label on the bottom, and they would ship me a new unit right away.  I did so, emailed her the photos, and within 3 days I had my brand new unit in hand!  I am still leaving off one star because the mechanical problem really should not have happened in just 8 months, but in all other aspects I LOVE this heater and the company.

Title: 10 days use & love this powerful, safe unit (failure rate hi but good 3 yr warranty)
Review Content: I just got one, then bought  another because I liked it so much. I’m reading all  the heater failure stories and just want to mention there’s a 3 yr warranty. I gave 5 stars bec ive had it 10 days & ❤️ it!  I read all the reviews with failure story- usually the fan screws up & touches the front with noises. One person contacted the manufacturer who sent a replacement out quickly. PLEASE VORNADO: FIX THIS LITTLE FELLA! ITS AWESOME BUT THE FAILURE RATE WILL PUT YOU OUT OF BUSINESS! I ALMOST DIDNT BUY IT BECAUSE OF THE REVIEWS! I think everyone who has a failure of this heater needs to contact Vornado for a new one! For the busy single working mom who couldn’t be hassled returning it for the right color: when  you set up the return on Amazon and the issue is their fault, the UPS guy will come to your house and pick up the package. I’ve had that happen to me so I know is that it is a VERY simple process. The more of us who DO that, the sooner they may fix the actual issue which would be great cuz it’s a very good heater! 😁 It DOES  put out significant heat at the 750 W setting. Yet this is still an economical wattage usage and I have found that it will heat a bedroom, bathroom even the master bedroom if I keep the door closed. The 350 or fan watt setting I use after a shower to dry the room or in my kitchen after mopping. I also got a cheap heater, not vornado, that gets really hot but concerningly so. It shut itself down after just about 15 mins on high & took forever to come back on (safety feature). The vornado has never had to do that & I’ve used it all night. The other model isn’t as steady on the floor as this little vornado is either.

Title: Terrific little heater!
Review Content: This is my second Vornado fan.  My first one lasted for about six years until I dropped it and something broke inside.  I immediately ordered another one because I can't live without one for about eight months out of the year!  Don't expect it to heat an entire room, but it's great to have it close when sitting still. I keep mine on the lower shelf of my coffee table to keep my feet warm when I read or work on my laptop.  I have a Black and Decker heater at work, but it's much louder and moves across the desk as it vibrates.  This one is quiet, nice-looking, and designed not to tip or move.  I also just discovered it has a fan-only mode (the middle position on the switch)!  I highly recommend it.

This fan was perfect for that.  My only caveat is I haven't had it very long.  So I'll need to see how it holds up over time.  But everything else is great about it.

Title: Good heater for those with mild winters
Review Content: Living in Southern California I wouldnt call our winters, very winterish most of the time. It never dips below freezing in the metro areas except on the rare occasion. Knowing this I didnt want to go all out on a ~1500watt heater for two reasons. I dont need a whole room heater and I dont wish to play pop the circuit since the wiring here is awful.These little personal heater is exactly what its designed to be; a small, under or on desk source of warmth. The highest power setting is around 700watts, so half of a full sized heater. The heat it does put it out is quite nice however, on high you can just leave you feet near it without too hot. As some others have stated the air is only warm for about a foot or two then it dissipates. Again, not a con for me since its on my desk or nightstand when I use it.The fan has a mild sound to it, nothing worse than any other small heater Ive had. Its probably on the same sound level, but the sound itself is "softer", ie the air sounds free flowing versus being forced through a radiator.However, Im still giving it 3 stars for a couple of issues.-The fan motor is not balanced or balanced like garbage. At points during usage it begins to vibrate and move about on hard surfaces. Sometimes a quick tap/thump on the case will sort it but other times it just has to work itself out. Not sure if this is a shipping issue or just a bearing issue but after reading complaints about fan noise I believe its a design flaw/oversight. Im going to let itself run for a bit, maybe the bearings were dry and see what happens. If not I will return it, there is no reason for a simple and small fan not be balanced.-The second reason is more of a nitpick. Its only ETL rated, not the more stringent UL which for something like this I would prefer.Update: The motor has only gotten worse, it still walks about periodically and this morning the entire unit failed. Nothing smells burnt or appears damaged, the orange warning light is lit so probably a fuse inside has failed. Im on the fence about replacing or returning it, its a nice design but it just feels cheap and apparently is also made with cheap components.

Title: Small but mighty
Review Content: As the chill of winter settles in, finding a reliable heating solution becomes paramount. Enter the small yet mighty heater that promises to keep you warm and cozy during the coldest months.Its compact design makes it perfect for small spaces, whether it's your office cubicle, bedroom, or RV.There is no oscillating function but it does ensure even heat distribution throughout my small living room & bedroom.While the heater may not be suitable for heating large spaces, it excels in its intended purpose: providing efficient and reliable heating in small areas. Its compact size makes it a must-have for anyone looking to stay warm and comfortable during the colder months. Overall, I highly recommend the for anyone in need of a reliable heating solution for small spaces.

Title: Perfect low key heater

It’s tiny enough to pack in my small bag, also to bring along when traveling where it has also packed a needed punch. I enjoy its silent operation and low watts use so I don’t need to worry about overloading a circuit.

Title: Perfect little heater
Review Content: I purchased this heater for the office since I sit near a window and it can get chilly. I also own a vornado personal desk fan as well. This manufacturer in my opinion puts out a great product. Their products work great and hold up well over time so it made sense to go with their heater. I am so glad that I did because this little heater works great for my small work space. I used it in my bedroom for two days after reading some reviews that it let off a burning smell right out of the box. I really didn’t notice a smell after about 5 minutes. There are two heat settings and one fan only settings which I didn’t realize it had (shown in picture). I don’t see where I’d use this setting, but I believe it’s to circulate the air. No heat comes out with the fan only setting. The air flow is the same for high and low air settings - one is just noticeably warmer than the other. I find that I use the high setting the most but I like to be warm more than just “comfortable”. It also has a safety feature that turns off the unit should it get knocked over (shown in picture). This heater will not heat a small room. It works best when in direct contact of the air flow just like a fan. I would go with one of their larger models if you’re looking to warm your room/bedroom, etc. I recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a great heater for a small space.

Title: Good office space heater, except for the fan blade issues
Review Content: This is a great little heater to hide in an office, since it's quiet and the output works well.The problem (as mentioned in other reviews) is that the fan blades seem to shift forward over time. The fan will start to make noise (especially when starting up) and eventually will not run at all since it gets stuck against the front of the heater housing.You can remedy the fan blade issue by opening it up and pushing the plastic blade assembly back onto the shaft a bit. To do that you need a long (6" works) #1 phillips driver for the screws on the bottom/back of the heater and one of the top screws. The other screw that needs to be removed on the top/back was a security screw for me (how dumb) so you will need a small spanner security driver for that. Don't remove the screws in the middle of the back, those hold the motor assembly onto the case. Then just push the fan blades back a little and reassemble.I have only had to push the fan blades back once after 2 years, if it does it again I will add some adhesive to the shaft to stop the movement.It's kinda silly the manufacturer didn't notice this problem? Do they test these things?

Title: I am no longer freezing at work
Review Content: To say it makes zero noise is false… but you will forget it is on. This is a wonderful tool to keep you warm. I work in the courthouse and it is freezing all the time. Nothing I can do about that… until now. I feel like I have an island breeze at my desk…. And I have put a scented air freshener in front of it to add a little “something”. LOL.Others in the office have now huddled in to my cubicle to w up! So it has become a movement! Plus there are no coils! If you tilt the fan it turns off. Perfect! Plus it isn’t an eye sore! Well done

Title: Best personal heater, and improved material since the last one I bought
Review Content: The Vornado VH202 Personal Space Heater is the best personal heater I've found. It's quieter than most others and has the best selection of heat settings for my uses. This isn't going to heat a room, but it's a great choice if you like to have a little warm air blowing directly on you. This is the second one I've had, and the case seems to have been made from a better plastic. The old one gave off a very strong plastic smell when it was new, and the smell was an issue for months.  Over time the case became misshaped in areas that seemed to get extra hot. Despite those drawbacks it was so much better than others I've tried that I purchased it again. I was pleasantly surprised that I never noticed any unpleasant smells, and I haven't noticed any hot spots or distortion of the case. In my opinion it is now the best personal fan available.

Title: SYNERGISTIC EFFECT
Review Content: The temperature has been in the lower 40s lately so I had been running the built in electric wall heater in my  apartment living room.  Then I got the heating bill for last month so I decided to try this heater/fan combination.  Found that if have it on the high 700 watt setting and I position it a few feet away from my small 750 watt quartz infrared heater, there is a "synergistic" effect.  The heat from the two spreads around my large living room instead of just going in one direction.  Now I only need to use the wall heater for a quick blast now and then.  This heater/fan combination makes a nice quiet noise that could almost be used as a white noise machine for sleep. Very happy with this purchase.

Title: #1 Arrived in damaged box with loud clacking noise, #2 seems okay
Review Content: 1st Package: The outer shipping box was in near-perfect condition.  However, the inside (retail packaging) box had significant damage on multiple sides, and appeared to have previously been opened then re-sealed.  Damage was definitely NOT incurred during shipping, and the heater itself did not show visible damage.  Plugged the unit in and started it.  LOUD, rapid clacking noise like the fan blades were hitting the case or something similar. If I pressed down on the top of the heater outside casing enough to flex the outer casing (it is thin plastic), the noise would stop until I removed my hand.  Seems like maybe this unit was defective and someone else had returned it previously before they shipped it to me???Heat output and fan volume were fine for a low cost unit of this size.  I specifically wanted a unit that did NOT have a 1500W ouput to avoid excessive load on the circuit when used with other items.  NOTE: The bottom of this unit quickly becomes VERY hot when in use so I'd recommend putting on something that won't burn.Amazon approved a replacement right away so we'll see what the second unit is like. If it has the same problem I'll go for a refund and try another one.Replacement unit arrived promptly and doesn't have the the noise problems of the first.  Upgraded the review to a 3 since the second (replacement) unit arrived promptly and works as advertised.

Title: Quiet & Safe just not as warm as I prefer
Review Content: I've been using this under my desk at work now for about 2 weeks.  My work said I had to get a new space heater since the one I had purchased before didn't have the safety switch off when turned over.  I really liked my other heater too because it was super warm.Well I decided to purchase this one because of the safety features and reviews.  Unfortunately, it doesn't get near as warm as my last heater.  In fact, I'm not sure that its going to work for me in the very cold winters. It's spring and only getting to lows of 40's it breaks the cold but doesn't make me feel hot.  It barely makes me warm unless I put my feet right up to it.  I read that in one of the reviews I saw but still purchased anyway.It doesn't have much of a force of air but that's probably why it is so quiet.The safety switch on it works great as soon as you pick it up off the floor it turns off.  So literally every day when I go home from work I just tip it over to turn it off instead of flipping the switch on the back.  Then when I get back in the morning I flip it back up.I thought about returning it and buying something else.  But its kind of a hassle to return things so I've decided I'll keep it for now and replace it when winter gets closer with something more powerful and safe.

Title: Happy with Heater, Even 1 Year Later
Review Content: Bought this for my non-insulated laundry room last winter and it did the trick, as I expected from Vornado.  Where it has shined however, is in my bedroom - Heat just went out this holiday weekend and boy is it COLD!! Not enough socks and blankets for a house in the upper 50's and dropping until we can even try to reach HVAC repairman to schedule an appointment. Brought this little Vornado heater in and my room is a comfy 71F and my husband isn't complaining about icicle toes. Happy with the brand and happy with this heater.

Title: Perfect for your desk
Review Content: I'm always cold, plus I live in MN. I recently started working from home, so I was looking for something to heat up my office and hands so I didn't have to crank up the heat in my whole house all day. This absolutely does the trick! If I keep the door to my small office closed, it gets toasty warm in less than an hour. I find myself even turning this thing off halfway through the day. I keep it sitting on top of my desk right next to my mouse, so my hands are extra warm, and it's great. Tried a few other models, more powerful ones, and while they warmed up the room, they were more $$$ to run, and my hands still weren't warm. This one definitely wins.

Title: Makes it so much easier to get my morning started.
Review Content: I have this in my bathroom, hooked up to a smart plug (TP-Link Kasa - also controllable with Alexa) It's set to turn on about 8 minutes before my other devices in my morning wake-up routine, so by the time i wake up, the bathroom, especially the floor, is nice and comfortably warm, so i'm not freezing cold in the morning.I was told, however, to turn it off before running the shower, as the humidity in the air caused by the shower isn't good for it. I've been doing that and it's been working well. I just tell Alexa (as i said, it's hooked to a smart plug to do this) to turn it off before i turn the shower on.So the point is, the smart plug cuts or feeds power to it, just like unplugging and plugging it back in would do. So you turn it on, and if you feed it with power, it will run as expected. it's a simple device but that makes this easy to do.

Title: Warm, Low Watts, Quiet
Review Content: Amazing that this little heater can warm our travel trailer even on the lowest setting (although we're in So California so not asking much of it).  VERY quiet compared to other small heaters we've tried.  We wanted something with a low wattage option and this tested at about 350 watts on low and 650 watts on high. Medium is just a fan setting (no heat).  We put it at the other end of the trailer (on a heat resistant cutting board, sitting on a chair) and use a ten dollar remote to turn it on in the morning if we want to heat up the unit for a bit before getting out of bed. Not sure you want to do what we do since that may not sound fire-marshall approved, but the tip over function works well and the unit does not seem to get that warm to the touch. Have also recommended to people in offices where a couple 1500 watt heaters run up the electric bill and are hard on shared circuits... If you think of a regular space heater (1500 watts) as running fifteen! one hundred watt bulbs and how much effort you go to with LED lights to save energy then trying this little heater first makes a lot of sense.

Title: Heats a small room beautifully!
Review Content: This Vornado VH202 Personal Space Heater heats up my chilly bathroom perfectly. The safety features work well, the outer casing gets warm to the touch, but not hot, and it fits in the under-sink cabinet when not in use. This is very much a small-room heater, though; don't rely on this for a great room or open-plan living room heating. When used for what it's designed for, this little heater is champion.

This is very much a small-room heater, though; don't rely on this for a great room or open-plan living room heating. When used for what it's designed for, this little heater is champion.

Title: Nice supplemental heat for bedroom, not a good under desk heater
Review Content: I love this little heater for adding 4 or 5 degrees to the bedroom and more importantly to me it has enough fan power to get rid of cold spots like near the window, which is where our bed is.  it's not a high heat heater and works best using long run times.  To me it has too much fan to be used as an under desk heater, the air is cooler feeling due to the large volume, but that makes it really nice for warming a small area, just not your feet.  If you are looking for an under desk heater I use a Brightown heater I got on Amazon for under my desk, it's 400 watts, bright orange, tiny and that thing is perfect for your feet.

Title: Fantastic product, customer service, and guarantee
Review Content: This easily heats up a corner room in our  house that has no insulation. It's very energy efficient compared to most heaters, and is not a fire hazard like so many heaters. We put this on the nightstand, or on a stool at the other end of the bedroom and after ten minutes on setting II, it can maintain the heat on setting I. If it's picked up or tipped, it automatically turns off.We bought a second one after the one a friend bought for us died. They both died the same way within a year - something inside was catching and I could smell burning and then it would stop trying to work. I didn't even have a receipt for the first one and customer service replaced both! I haven't had any problems with the replacements.This experience turned me on to Vornado in a big way. Now all of our rooms have Vornado air circulators in them for summer. LOVE THEM. I'd highly recommend.

Title: A good little heater w/ low setting
Review Content: I bought this Vornado because I wanted a smaller heater and already was happy with the larger 1800W Vornado I own. Is it more efficient? Well it draws less watts than the heater is listed at, but one doesn’t know how many BTUs it actually produces so who knows whether it actually is efficient.As a personal heater its fine. It doesnt not have a thermostat control like the larger model; just high and low. It is stable on the floor.I am happy w/ the heater except it is noisier than I expected. My larger Vornado is whisper quiet; one barely hears it. This small unit is not, but it is fairly quiet. I ordered it expecting it too would be ‘whisper’ quiet, so I’m disappointed by that

Title: Essential for winter
Review Content: I have been using Vornado products for probably 40 years.  I needed a small personal space heater for my home office and immediately looked for a Vornado product.  It is right here with me as I write this review.  Efficient, quiet, and effective for the intended purpose.  Given my experience with my other Vornado products [fans, heaters, air purifiers] I expect this little heater to be with me for a long time.  One customer service note:  about a year ago the control knob on one of my fans broke.  I emailed Vornado customer service and asked for a list of replacement parts for this particular fan, explaining my need for a replacement knob.  3 days later a new knob arrived in the mail.  Can't ask for much better customer service than that.

Title: GOOD LITTLE FAN
Review Content: I’m a big fan of Vornado cooling fans (I own several), so I thought I’d try this small space heater for my bathroom.I live in California, so our winters aren’t too severe, but I do tend to get cold.  I purchased this in Nov 2016, so this will be my 3rd cold season with it.I bought it due to its small size to use in my bathroom.  It’s compact enough to keep on my counter, and heats up my rather large bathroom just fine, definitely enough to take the chill off.The one thing to keep aware of, is that the automatic shut-off at the bottom is very effective.  I started to write a “disappointed” review because I thought it wasn’t going to work for me this year, then I realized the cord was laying under it enough to lift it up a tiny bit, activating the shut-off.  Duh!!!  It’s working great!!!!!

Title: I've had two, and both stop working after about a year.
Review Content: Just to preface this review, I've now had two of these, and I hate to write this review because they were perfect... while they worked. Unfortunately, after about a year, the first one started making this horrible clicking sound when I first turned it on. A loud clicking sound. So loud in fact, that my coworkers came into my office to ask what "that weird sound" was. The heater would make this sound for about 2 minutes, and then would get quieter and act like normal. However, after about a week of it doing this each time I turned it on, one day, it completely stopped working. It no longer would do anything at all when I turned it on. No air blowing, and just smelled like burning plastic.Since it had worked perfectly up until this point, I figured it was a fluke and ordered another one. However, it has now been about a year since I purchased this second replacement, and THE EXACT SAME THING HAPPENED. It started making the dreaded clicking sound when I would turn it on, did this for about a week, and then today it completely stopped working and smelled like burning plastic. This makes me sad, because it was a completely silent heater and put out the perfect level of heat for my office. But after having two with the exact same problem, I can no longer buy this brand. Time to look elsewhere! I'm giving it two stars because like I said, it was perfect while it worked.

Title: Good heater
Review Content: Have had one of these for quite a few years and it's still going strong.  Needed another for office and am using this one by the desk.  Works great for the small space and warms up the area nicely.  It doesn't get overly hot which I prefer.  Fan doesn't blast out air which I also prefer.  It's a low level fan blowing warm air.  Not noisy.  No problems so far and have been using it almost daily for several weeks about 4 to 6 hours a day with some turn off time when away from desk.  Will update if any issues arise.

Title: For warming the room quickly
Review Content: Very quiet, distributes heat evenly,At the highest (warmest) setting, it won’t burn your hand if you put your hand close to the grill frame,For some, this may not feel hot enough. But this is warm enough for me.When I first used it, I turned on the extraction fan in the 8x12x10 bathroom. A mistake. Heat naturally rises to the ceiling and the fan quickly takes the heat out of the room. Having learned the lesson, I now pre-warm the room by not turning on the extraction fan, until I’m ready to use the bathroom. Problem solved,Seems like a well made product, with nice built in safety features. Hope the on/off switch will last as this button is used most frequently.Recommended.

Title: Great mini heater
Review Content: I was a little nervous when I purchased this mini heater but I actually love it ! For the price and size it works great! It does move so you’ll have to place it on top of something that will keep it still that’s my only problem with it but I keep it on my bed cause it doesn’t move and I can feel the heat better it puts me to sleep ... my room is not that big. It actually heats up a little room but it does not get toasty hot ! If your looking for a heater that is very very hot it’s not the one for you ... but I  recommend this small heater  for a a small room, small area and bathroom!

Title: Arrived Broken; Vornado Replaced
Review Content: This tiny space heater won't heat a room, but it will make you cozy when pointed straight-on. Not bad for the price.Also, if it arrives broken, Vornado Support is very good about issuing a replacement.All in all, a decent mini heater unit.

Title: Keeps my Feet Warm Under the Desk
Review Content: Bought this for under my desk during the winter to warm my otherwise cold feet. After some experimenting I determined the LOW setting, with it aimed at my feet, about 18" away, was the best. I could leave it all on day (9 hours) and be comfortable, not too hot.YES, there is a slight odor when its on the heat setting and running but only for the first minute or so. Either that or I stop noticing it. The odor is no big deal at all.YES, it makes a little noise. Come-on folks... it's a fan in a plastic housing, not the AC in a Lexus. As with the odor, the noise is minimal. It does not distract me as I work. After a few minutes I don't realize its on until I turn it off at 5:00.This fan is another excellent value doing exactly what it is designed to do.

Title: Heat is not well adjusted
Review Content: This is a great little product. It's safe because it switches off if it falls over, etc. There is a fan that works fine. The hottest setting is too hot - you have to put it at a distance. The lower heat (which I really want) is weak, so you have to have it a couple of inches away to feel the benefit. It's a fine product, it just needs better heat adjustment.

Title: Best personal space warm/cool fan
Review Content: This is my favorite appliance. I can't believe how well it works and how durable it is. I have blood pressure problems and one moment. I am overheated. The next moment, I'm freezing cold. It also has a low setting that falls between heat and cold. I have knocked it onto the floor so many times and it still keeps going. I was also allowed to keep it with me in the hospital because it's not considered a space heater. It is a warm/cold fan with no metal working parts. It's absolutely perfect for a small area or even if it's next to you while you are sitting at your desk. I have bought several personal heaters over the years and this is my absolute favorite.

Title: Great small space heater
Review Content: The home office area in my downstairs can get rather cold. I had a small Sunbeam space heater for years, but it finally broke (that was a pretty good heater, too).So, after some research, I found this one, the Vornado VH202. It's simple, it's compact, and they have a good reputation.Got it setup this morning, and wow, what a great little heater.  It's a simple design, with one fan speed; on.  It's gentle but it travels a long way. The heat settings are equally simple; none, 375 watts, and 750 watts. The low setting is perfect... not too hot, not too cool.Anyway, this one definitely gets my approval.

Title: Great price & works great!
Review Content: I love Vornado products and have purchased some of their more expensive heaters & fans before (all still in use!), but I was shocked at just how powerful this little heater is. I bought  this for a  tiny room rental I have as extra heat during winter. Ended up using for my office (was using one of those tall oscillating, hot to touch heaters). This cute little heater works great...heats a rather large room (14x16) quickly & quietly & won’t burn you if you accidentally touch it. Wish it had a remote like my other Vornados, but for the price, totally worth it! I’d definitely buy one again if I needed more heat.

Title: Great little suplimental or personal space fan (see update)
Review Content: This is a well made stable personal space heater with strong tip-over protection so I feel it's really safe. It has a nice fan that's both gentle and big enough to get the heat out a few feet. Very comfortable to be near. Even on high it's not a blast furnace or too hot to sit near. It's just right. I use this in my shop on a thermostatically controlled outlet to keep everything from freezing when I'm not out there. When I am I use the high setting to take the edge off the cold. It keeps my 12 x 36 shop nice on cooler days down to perhaps 45 or so. I have a larger heater for when it's really cold and I want to work out there. I knocked a star off because this heater stank so badly the first time it was used I nearly packed it up and sent it back. But that went away quickly.Update Feb.2019: Lasted about 3 years with VERY light use.

Title: HOLY COW!!!!
Review Content: I currently live in an old house. Old houses are known for being notoriously drafty, and this houses no exception. My room is a pretty average size, but it also has 3 large windows that are extremely drafty. There is also a door in my room that leads to a back area that stays freezing cold in the winter time, that also has 3 large windows There are very drafty, and it's all made worse by the fact that door does not close, and my room door has a large space underneath it that lets in cold air from the outside of it. The house does have radiator heaters, but they really don't heat up very well, and a lot of times you could barely tell when they are on. I don't get cold easily, and I prefer the cold over heat, So you know it's cold when I have to invest in a heater. 2 years ago I had about a $30 small room heater from Walmart and the heat put out on it was so bad I had to sleep with it underneath my blanket. Many times i'd set it on my side table so it could blow in my face, and i'd still be Freezing cold. I decided to just barrel through with it, until it randomly went out on me last month.  I decide to search for a heater on Amazon that was small but had a good heat put out with a good reviews, as I don't need a very large heater since I get hot easily.. let me tell you, this little heater is no joke. to feel the difference from my room to stepping out into the rest of the house as astronomical, You could definitely feel the difference, and it seems to be about a 30 degree difference. There is a knob on the back so you can adjust the temperature, but even the lowest temperature has a very high heat put out. I don't like sleeping with a lot of clothes on, as I've mentioned before I get hot easily. before I got this heater, i'd have to sleep with 2 blankets, as well as socks and A fuzzy onesie or a hoodie and sweatpants, but now I can walk around my room freely in a tank top and shorts And I'm Hot with only one blanket.  I also can't sleep when I'm overheated,  So for the first time  Since I've had this heater, or any other heater, I've had to turn off so I can sleep because of how hot it is. Even my cats burst through my door every time I open it so they can be in the room because of how warm it is common since the rest of the house is very cold.  It automatically turns off if it's not on an even surface. When I first plugged it up, I thought it was broken, but it did not register to me that it didn't turn on because I was holding it in my hands at an angle Paul, but as soon as I set it down it powered up, so it's definitely safe if you have things moved around or children running about. the outside of it does get a little hot though, but not so hot to the touch where you would burn yourself on it. it's completely metal, so it would still be a good idea to be cautious. Bonus points for it coming in cute colors!
