Title: Tip sensor failed —> RESOLVED
Review Content: Updated review (see original below) - So the tip over sensor in my heater failed in the “on” position, so the fan would stay on even if tipped. It got progressively worse after my original review and ended up melting part of the assembly on the inside that the tip sensor wires plugged into. I cut the wires and bypassed the tip sensor altogether. I STRONGLY recommend against doing this!! My heater is being used to heat a small greenhouse and poses almost no fire risk and even if it did start a fire, it would be sequestered to a safe area. That being said, I strongly believe that the malfunction I had was a fluke and not something that in and of itself could have caused a fire. Otherwise, this is a fantastic little forced air heater. FWIW, if you’re handy, it wouldn’t be difficult at all to upgrade the fan inside of it to a stronger/better fan since it’s a computer sized fan, do that at your own risk though. Despite my issue, I still liked this heater enough to originally give it three stars. I’m changing it to five because of the customer service. I never reached out to them because I assumed it would go the way most other negative Amazon experiences tend to go and I ultimately had a working fan. However, iSiler reached out to me to offer me a full refund of the product with a genuine apology. It didn’t feel too much like a cookie cutter response and they aren’t making me jump through hoops to receive the refund. The fact they went out of their way to get me my money back says an enormous amount about the business, and I’ll 100% buy any products they carry that I need from them in the future if they have it.——original review——Pretty okay little heater for the cost. It seems to be about average in noise production, but I think it stands out from the rest in its class aesthetically. My only problem with it is that the little button on the bottom failed in the “fan on” position. Not the button itself, it still moves up and down, but the fan doesn’t turn off.

Title: Excellent heater, excellent customer service!
Review Content: Excellent product with excellent customer service! We did quite a bit of research for a low budget space heater that would be as low toxic and emf safe as we could afford and find. We bought this after it was recommended to us and have been very satisfied! The original heater did end up randomly dying on us about 8 months after we purchased it, but we remembered there was a 1 year warranty and reached out to the company for support. They were fast, kind, effective, and sent us a replacement right away after confirming our original order number. We appreciated the efficiency and care as we were right in the middle of some heavy midwestern winter weather and a little space heater makes a lot of difference in our home! Would recommend!

Title: Walking Down the Memory Lane for Fun
Review Content: First of all, I did not order this heater. It was my wife who, while I turned my back for five minutes, decided it would be fun to have a heater looking like a memento from bad old times. Indeed, this industrial style was very common in the Soviet Union some fifty years ago. And fun it was! I vividly recalled those days, though I do not think that was what the manufacturer intended.As one could expect from this not-really-consumer-but-rather-industrial design, this heater is not for weaklings. It requires some assembly, which should have been easy except for… Just like about any consumer product in USSR, from a bookshelf to a car, the assembly is not as straightforward as the manual suggests.First, I could not insert the tabs of the supporting stand into the cutouts in the unit's bottom. When I looked closely, I realized that one of the cutouts was obstructed by some inner part, see the picture. Reluctantly, I decided to remove the casing and see what was wrong with the inner assembly. Not big deal! Just unscrew eight screws at the sides of the unit. Now I could see that the piece overlapping with the hole was a plastic lug intended to interlock with the stand tab. There are two of them on each side of the plastic chassis, which itself is attached to the bottom of the casing. Unfortunately, the chassis was off to one side, so that one tab would not catch the lug, while the other would not allow to push the tab through the cutout in the bottom. Since I came that far… Releasing two more screws which hold the chassis to the bottom, pushing the stand in and adjusting it, making sure the tabs are securely interlocked with the lugs, and tightening the bottom screws. Almost there. Screwing on the upper part of the casing, and… The whole unit is skewed; it stands on three points instead of all four, and toggles slightly on the flat surface. We-ell… After all, it makes sense because I had to stress the construction when I forced the chassis to the middle of the bottom to align the lugs with the holes. Do you know how to fix it? I do. Loosen all screws, ask my wife to lean over the unit to slightly overcompensate the existing skew, and tighten the screws in this position. After releasing the tension, the unit is perfectly right. Ugh!After all these exercises, the heater is now totally OK. It is just as powerful as any other heater on the market, the same 1.5 kW, but much smaller than most of them. The cord is soft, and the wire gauge seems to be right, so the cord does not get warm. I would prefer this heater to have a 3-pole plug and cord to ground the metal heater casing, but not all our wishes are granted.All in all, I would give this heater three stars for the assembly quality that badly needs improvement. My wife is still thrilled by its appearance of a toy-sized version of a full-grown industrial thing and suggests five stars. So, four stars it gets.P.S. Assembly hint. Contrary to the assembly instructions, its more convenient to start assembly from attaching the base stand, then continue with attaching the top handle. Otherwise, with the handle attached, you won’t be able to place the unit flat on its top while attaching the stand.

Title: ISILER Space Heater Review – 4.3/5 Stars
Review Content: The ISILER Space Heater is a reliable and efficient choice for keeping your space warm and cozy. Its 1500W ceramic heating element provides quick and consistent heat, and the adjustable thermostat is a great feature, allowing you to customize the temperature to your comfort. The compact and portable design makes it perfect for use in various spaces, from home offices to garages.I appreciate the safety features, especially the tip-over and overheat protection, which provide peace of mind when using the heater. The ETL certification adds an extra layer of trust in its safety and quality.My only drawback is the noise level. While not overly disruptive, it’s noticeable enough to detract from the experience, particularly in quieter settings. If you’re sensitive to noise, this might be something to consider.Overall, the ISILER Space Heater delivers excellent performance and safety features, making it a solid choice despite the noise. For its value and efficiency, it earns a strong 4.3 out of 5 stars.

Title: Nice LITTLE heater ... wish it had mult power settings
Review Content: First off ... the way the heater casing is coated it gives off the appearance that its made out of plastic (so not really that vintage metal heater vibe you may be thinking of).  That said,  seems to put out good heat.  Simple controls ... and the Safety Features you'd expect.  The only thing I see this unit is missing (compared to similar units), is the ability to manage your heat setting.  So its Max wattage or off (i.e. no option for a 700W or ECO setting).  So if you live in a home prone to blowing circuits ... or an RV where high wattage may be a concern ... this may not be the unit for you.  Nonetheless super small and simple ... and that certainly has its benefits!UPDATE:  My wife saw my cool little gray heater, and that led to her ordering the green model (older edition with handle and riser on the front).  Now that we have both units sitting side-by-side some of the discrepancies in the reviews I read now make sense - Let me summarize (i.e. as it appears the newer model attempts to address what were presumably the common complaints with the original)1.)  The newer model (gray/pink) comes fully assembled -->  Older edition requires some somewhat temperamental install of Handle and Riser2.)  The newer model has a plastic 'looking' casing (and doesn't really seem to get hot to the touch) -->  The older model is steel construction (nostalgic & cool . . . but does get warm)3.)  The newer model's fan & 'On' light shut off when the desired temperature is reached -->  Although the heating element in the older model shuts off when desired temp is reached, the fan & 'On' light remain on 100% of the time while the unit is in the On position (i.e. Power switch in On position).4.)  (this one is purely cosmetic. . . for those who even care/notice)  The newer model has an "On" light which is hidden behind the front grill in the Center of the heating element  -->  The older model has an "On" light which is in the bottom left hand corner of the grill - i.e. and actually results in the heating element being slightly offset to one side within the casing.5.)  Overall the newer model is slightly larger than the older model (but they're BOTH very small/compact compared to the typical space heater)So hopefully that helps clarify some key differences for those deciding between units - Cheers!

Title: Huge heat from a small space heater!
Review Content: We purchased the ISILER Space Heater in March of 2022 to heat my large home office with tile flooring, located in an old and not well-insulated addition at the back of our house, during the cold months of Massachusetts. The office, which had been used as a family room prior, had many windows and an exterior door, and there was no basement below it. The room was heated with a wall-mounted gas Rinai heater and always felt cold, especially the floor, but with the added ISILER space heater, the entire room felt comfortable! This small space heater generates some huge heat, even on the lower heat settings, and lasted for nearly three years before finally not turning back on. Love the compact size, the heat output, and the design — worth every penny.

Title: Solid heater.
Review Content: Puts out good heat in the small form factor. My only gripe is it's not super adjustable. Low barely puts out anything then the next step up all the way to max is comparable in that it puts out a lot of heat. I wish there was a good medium setting. The dial shows like 4 settings but in reality I'm only feeling, hearing two settings. The fan is also slightly noisy. Nothing crazy but you definitely notice its on (which I suppose good be a good reminder to turn it off when done).Overall for the price it's super solid, just wish it had one or two more features.

Title: Attractive mid-century style space heater
Review Content: The Isiler space heater worked exactly as advertised. It arrived fully assembled and ready-to plug in.  It is compact, sturdy, and available in fun colors, which tend to match other products we own that are sold by Isiler. The noise level from the fan is on par with other brands of the same size space heaters we have used in the past.  The tip-over safety button on the bottom of the heater box triggered immediately and consistently when pressure was relieved from sitting solidly on a flat surface.  It is uncomplicated to operate – you turn it on, set the dial for desired temperature level, and enjoy.  The space heater puts out a level of warmth like two other similar size space heaters that we own and did not over-heat the floor directly in front of it.  As a caution – the front grill gets very hot when the heater is operating (as our two other different brands of space heaters do). We would not use any space heater in the vicinity of small children or pets without constant supervision.  It took the chill off our large family room and would also be perfectly suited for a smaller room or office by adjusting the temperature level down on the dial. An additional safety feature not included with this space heater is a built-in timer that would time off, for example, after one hour.  All in all, it is a good little heater at a good price.

Title: Gets the job done.

Manually Corrected Review Content: This little heater really does the job.  I use it in my 6 x 6 greenhouse and it keeps it at a steady 65 degree night temperature (in a Texas winter).

Title: Great Little Heater With Two Caveats
Review Content: Nothing wrong at all with this heater. Bought it mainly because it's one of the few not made primarily of plastic.  Although the instruction manual did advise to run it on high for 2 hours outside or in a well ventilated area the first time to burn off any plastic residue so there must be some inside there somewhere.  It really kicks out the heat. And despite what the description says it actually doesn't get that hot to the touch.  I didn't even bother putting the handle on and have no issues with moving it around during use if I need to.  The caveats you should know about are these:  First, it doesn't have automatic temperature control, meaning you set it to a certain temp and it turns itself off/on to maintain that room temperature. When you put it on it stays on.  Where this gives me trouble is if I have it on too high overnight it gets too hot in the room to the point it wakes me up. So on a cold night you set it to be toasty when you are going to sleep but by the time it's 2am you wake up roasting. Have to be mindful to not set it too high if just using it to heat your bedroom.  The second caveat is it is really not that quiet. The fan runs louder than the last space heater I had, and if you are planning to use it in a room where you are watching tv, know that you'll need to crank up the tv volume a bit as the fan on this thing can be a bit overpowering. On the other hand, it could be good for 'white noise' when needed.

Title: Small but mighty
Review Content: I have used a number of electric indoor space heaters over the years, and this one is my favorite so far. This heater is physically very small, but make no mistake, it puts out a lot of heat. It has no trouble warming up an average size bedroom or bathroom. Keep in mind that despite its small size, it is a 1500 watt heater, which is basically the maximum wattage you will ever see for an indoor space heater. My two previous space heaters were also 1500W, but they were physically larger and more bulky. So I actually really like the small size of this heater because it takes up less space, yet it puts out just as much heat as the bigger space heaters on the market.I also like that this heater is SIMPLE. Just an on/off switch, temperature switch (which I never use), tip over protection, and no other extra gizmos that would add complexity and rarely, if ever, be used.Another positive aspect of this heater is that it has all-metal construction (excluding the feet and handle). It looks and feels well constructed, and I prefer metal over plastic for a variety of reasons. Noteworthy is that this space heater does not produce noxious fumes, perhaps due in large part to being constructed primarily of metal rather than plastic. There was a very faint odor when I turned it on the first few times, but after that, it now produces ZERO bad smells. That was a big deal in my house, as my wife and I do not tolerate breathing toxic off-gassing fumes, which are somewhat common with space heaters.My only criticism, which is minor, is that the fan could be a little quieter. It is not loud by any means, and quickly fades in the background as white noise, but that's the only thing about it that I would say isn't a home run. Ultimately, I am highly impressed by this powerful little heater. 100% recommended.

Title: Great for Small Space Emergencies
Review Content: After I visited family for the holidays, I came back home to a broken heater unit in one room. Try as I might, my heater in the other room just wouldn't heat up my bedroom too. I didn't get to have anybody scheduled to come fix the heater until mid-February (6 weeks after the heater stopped), and I wasn't willing to sit in the cold.In came this little beastie!! For reference, my bedroom is roughly 12x13 ft and this little heater gets the room cozy. If you close the door and turn the heat up, you can get a really solid heat going on. If you just want some casual, cozy, I'm-pretending-I-have-a-fireplace vibes, turn the temperature knob down and enjoy the warmth in your little corner. Don't sit too close to it, because it can pack a punch.There's a little button/lever on the bottom of the heater that depresses when it's on the floor. If you pick up or move the heater and that button releases, the heater automatically turns off. If you're worried about it tipping over, it's very stable, but rest assured that it does turn off immediately. The handle on top is also easy to hold and has never been hot to touch for me.Bonus: I bought the green version and it almost perfectly matches the color of my desk. Very cute!

Title: Limited opinion
Review Content: I recently purchased 2 of your 1500 watt, portable, ceramic heaters. One yellow, one grey.Upon first inspection it was obvious the yellow one had been opened. The bottom stand was already installed, it was re-wrapped poorly, and you could tell it wasn't in the box right. I figure it was a return that you just shipped to me. The grey one was packaged fine. Installing the handle proved difficult for my old hands as the holes for the screws in the case did not line up correctly. This was already mentioned in a previous review by someone else and I was still able to make it work. The grey one had a metal case with the handle incorporated into the design and only needed the base installed which was easy enough. As far as operation they both seem to work fine. I don't know if they can keep up with a long, cold, winter yet, but we shall see. For that reason I can't testify to long term operation.

Title: Solid little heater
Review Content: My room has large windows and is the furthest from the furnace in the house. It gets quite chilly. But it’s also a small room. I just wanted something to point at me and warm me while I’m in my chair. And it’s great for that. Although my room is small enough with the door closed it warms it up a couple degrees after running for an hour or so. It does have sort of a cooking smell. Not like fire or anything. It’s noticeable. But not bothersome. You can definitely hear the fan. The handle and bottom feet need to be assembled. And I have to say the pieces do not fit together great. Which gives me little confidence in terms of quality. However, works perfectly for keeping me from being uncomfortably cold. Still I wouldn’t get this with the purpose of warming a room though it does. More appropriate as a personal heater. Definitely don’t leave it on unattended. That seems like a dangerous game to play. But I also love how cute it is. I honestly would have bought just a space heater but they are all so ugly and this fits my room perfectly.

Title: What a space heater ought to be
Review Content: I already owned 2 large roll-around space heaters but this one seems more practical to me. For one thing, it might not be smart to heat a large space with an electric heater, especially since the most efficient way to get warm is to bring the source of heat closer to warm your body instead of wasting heat on the air across the room. This one's also perfect for where I see many people using them, at work, under a desk, where you can't expect the space you share with others to be kept at your own ideal temperature. I like that it's so small and low to the ground, meaning there's little danger of kicking it over, although, even if you did, the tip-over switch on the bottom shuts the unit off immediately. It seems to put out a surprising amount of heat for its size, and I can lay my hands on the yellow metal case and barely feel the heat, except at the very front where it comes out.

I use them to heat the upstairs and downstairs bathrooms before shower and toilet time as well as a personal heater in my home office. I live in New England so they get heavy from November to March. Apparently the newer units are not as good based on reviews which is a shame.

Title: Great Product!
Review Content: Received my new Isiler NPE-2 Electric Fan Heater today. I was quite impressed. The packaging was excellent - very secure and well padded. The build quality of the heater itself is also excellent - heavy-gauge materials and sturdy construction. Set-up was easy with all screws, handle and stand included.The small size is perfect. I set it up in the footwell of my desk and was amazed at the very strong but gentle heat it produces - it is blowing on my feet right now - VERY satisfactory. I will also be using it in my garage while I work on my hobby cars. The thermostat is easy to use to get the level of heat just right.One great safety point is that, even though the heat blowing out is surprisingly strong for its size, the exterior surface of the unit directly under the handle does not become too hot to touch - seems very well insulated - no chance of burning yourself if you pick it up while it is running.In other words, I'm extremely satisfied. I really don't know why I haven't bought one sooner, and would not hesitate to recommend it to my friends.One suggestion - it seems the tip-over switch only turns off the heater element, not the fan. Might be better if it turned off the fan as well? Maybe not, as then the fan would not cool off the deactivated heater element, but just a suggestion.

Title: The small size and price makes this a wonderful little space heater - and it has a metal case!
Review Content: I received the heater yesterday from Amazon, and my first impression was good.  I picked iSiler because of its metal case.  I have seen and used plastic models in the past but the metal case gives me additional confidence.  I have seen plastic space heaters warp and melt and they don't seem as safe.The unit was well packed and came as promised.  I had a little difficulty with the feet and handle.The feet did not want to click on easily.  I had to apply a little more pressure than I should but eventually, they clicked on.  The screws went in and felt secure.  I could tell that the screw was attaching to the metal plate and it felt very solid.The handle went in but the holes for the screws did not align up as they should.  I pulled the handle out and it looked like the holes were a little offset. I tried turning the handle 180 degrees to see which way they aligned up best.  One side did align but the other was off a bit.  I did, by pressing the handle in fairly hard, get the screw started and I was able to secure both sides. The screws felt like they were going into plastic and I was concerned with stripping them out.  Once the head bottomed out I stopped turning but felt like I should turn some more - but I did not want to take a chance of stripping the handle.The handle and feet function perfectly so I am happy the install was successful.The controls were easy and the unit worked as designed.  I feel I will be happy with the unit for a long time.Update:I have had the unit for a couple of months now and absolutely no issues.  I have moved it around the house and the handle is not loose and not showing any issues, this is my favorite little heater.

Title: Decent Heater but very poor thermostat
Review Content: 1. This is a review of the newer model (the handle and feed are integrated - no installation - stock picture from amazon attached for clarity vs. the earlier model)2. The heater will turn on when X temperature is reached3. The heater will NOT turn off when X temperature is surpassedThe on/off switch works.The tip-over switch works.The neither the cord nor the chassis become warm/hot.The heat output is as expected and works well for the advertised square footage.The problem is the thermostat. When this is turned just to the point of turning on the heater and then backed off there is significant slack present before the heater will then turn off. ie. turn the dial just to the point of the click and activation, to turn off with the dial then requires roughly a quarter turn before the heater will then turn off.In an internal room (well insulated etc.) that is ~10x11' with the door closed, once the heater turns on, it will NEVER automatically turn off (This is not in reference to the fan turning off but refers to both the heating element and the fan never ceasing operation). There appears to be too much "slack" in the thermostat range so the "ceiling" is never actually reached to then turn off the heater. (I assume the slack in turning off the heater also applies to the "ceiling" temperature to cause it to turn off -- effectively making the turn off temperature too high to ever be achieved/triggered)Does it work in general? With manual assistance/monitoring yes.Does this work, in terms of the thermostat settings, to a satisfactory level as compared to any other heater I have ever owned? No.Is it worth returning? No.It will largely work for the purpose to which it was purchased -- active when the person is in the subject room and manually dialed down when not.Would I recommend this as a fresh purchase to any other consumer? No.The exceptionally poor operation/tolerance range of the thermostat makes this substandard relative to many other heaters.

Title: The fan stopped blowing the hot air within 5 minutes of using the heater.
Review Content: I really wanted to like this little heater since it had some good reviews here. I live in New Hampshire and home heating prices have skyrocketed so I thought I would just keep the room I'm in warm with this little heater. But after plugging it in and having it run for 5 minutes the fan just stopped working which makes the heater unusable. Too bad there are some bad quality parts used in the construction.UPDATE... I changed my rating from one star to four stars. This was a very cute heater and I was really hoping to enjoy its warmth during the New England winter. Unfortunately due to product failure this did not work out and I returned it. But something unusual happened that has never happened to me before during my years of shopping on Amazon, the company contacted me and even though I had sent the heater back they were very sorry for the issues I had and sent me an Amazon gift certificate for my troubles! So my four-star rating is primarily based on customer service which is truly exceptional.

Title: It’s the “Little Engine that Could,” and over-performs!
Review Content: December 17, 2022I don’t normally write reviews due to time constraints, but I do put some time in up front to study the choices and the reviews on the product type I’m purchasing, 90% from Amazon.There are a lot of choices for space heaters, and I found yours was the best quality heater at a fair price.Not the cheapest, as I don’t shop that way, because quality is first when it comes to electric and electronic devices, as far as I’m concerned.I’m 66 and I live alone in an apt. I am on a limited income so I’d rather heat my room, and worry about the rest during the day. I simply move my iSiLER heater out to my front office room area, turn it on and in 20 minutes it goes from 55 degrees to 75 degrees in the entire room.I like the quality construction, the handle on top, the solid one-piece cabinet construction and stability and the heating element, which is controlled by an easy-to-get-used-to thermostat dial on the back.I’ve purchased heaters over the decades, including in the 1970’s when they were customized toaster ovens!I love my iSiLER space heater, and I know you will too. I hope this helps you choose after I did all the work!But that’s how I chose it too, thanks to others reviews.Sincerely,Scott Kennedy

Title: Put it under your desk!
Review Content: This is actually the second one that I have bought. This one for my son. My three year old one still works fine.I keep the heat down in the house to save money. Most of my time is spent in one room and I place this under my desk or work bench at the medium to low setting. Keeps me toasty while working and if I have the door closed will eventually heat the room. (ie. probably no the best choice if you want to heat a room)That said ,the heat control was malfunctioning after about two years and I was raise to at least try to fix it before throwing it away. Coupla screws and I had it working like new. I took the cover off and blew the dust/lint out of it recently and seems like it will last another three years. Small, Light and easy to move around and place it where needed and stable. My son moved out to a basement apt and I thought "perfect gift with winter coming on so I bought another for him.

Title: Life saver in a cold workshop
Review Content: Got this to put under my desk in an un-insulated workshop.For how small it is (it's really small), it puts out an impressive amount of directional heat. I have to turn down the heat to just under half setting to not burn up my legs. It makes me worried how hot it gets but I'm just paranoid and I unplug it when not using just in case. At least there is a small button on the bottom of it that shuts off if the unit is lifted or tipped over.Pros:- crazy heat- tiny size- cute design, great color and manufacturing finish--no sharp edges and easy to assemble- easy to use and set up- shuts off when rear is liftedCons:- there is a factory smell at first--probably manufacturing oils burning off- fan is a little on the loud side- wish it was lifted further off the ground/surface (do NOT set this near anything flammable)For the smell, I recommend just running this thing for like 10 minutes out the window or door. It should burn off any of the oils and chemicals or whatever else is on the factory parts.Overall, this unit gets an A+ for design and effectiveness.Can't evaluate long term yet, but so far it's pretty promising !

Title: Works Well
Review Content: I live in a 520 sqft apartment where the weather gets cold, this space heater warms it well! I fell safe leaving it on over night while making sure to follow safety precautions. I turn it on about 30 minutes before sleeping, by the morning my whole place is warm. I am still not sure how long it takes to heat the whole apartment to a consistent temperature. This little machine has changed my morning routine for the better. I used to be too cold to climb out of bed, not anymore.As for the quality of the space heater, it seems durable with quality metals and plastic. I did have some difficulty with installing the front bumper, there was some off set material. But once assembled, no issue.After being on for hours, the only part of the device that becomes hot to the touch is the back of the space heater. However, it seems easy to avoid except when turning the switch on and off or adjusting the temperature.I would recommend this product!

Title: Critical safety feature does not work - buyer beware / UPDATE - issue resolved!
Review Content: UPDATE: 12/31/20 - The seller, Cassie, contacted me and quickly resolved the unexpected defect issue on the heater I purchased. Their customer service was excellent and they followed up with several emails to confirm my satisfaction.  As I mentioned previously, the heater works well and I would recommend this product and seller to others considering a purchase.  Kudos to Cassie!Upon testing the heater/fan, the safety shutoff (tip over prevention) is not functioning.  I can lift the unit, tip it over, turn it upside down, lay it on the heater face and it does not shut the unit down.  The switch on the bottom is faulty and a safety risk.  Another minor quality issue is that the pre-drilled hole in the housing and the receiver hole in the handle do not align.  I was able to run the screw in at an exaggerated angle to secure the handle.The unit otherwise works well.  The fan is relatively quiet and it produces a nice amount of heat.  I like that the housing is metal and the unit is compact.  However, I cannot rate this item higher based on the failure of the manufacturer testing perhaps the most important feature of the product.  It is, in my opinion, a serious issue in quality control and puts the user at risk.  Had the safety feature functioned properly, I would have purchased a second unit.  I am now considering competitive products.

Title: On/off switch stopped working
Review Content: **EDIT**The vendor reached out and provided a code to purchase a replacement. Great customer service. Changing the review from 2 stars to 4 stars. The inconvenient part of this was having to run to the store to get a replacement so quickly because we rely on a space heater for our very cold office. Glad the company reached out and offered a replacement though!Original post -We bought this in February 2020 to use when our baby was born. We didn’t use it very long because it was just to warm up the space after bath time for my newborn. We packed it away after a month or so of just using it for 5 minutes each night.We now live in Chattanooga, TN and have been using it for about a month or two to heat up our sun room/office space. The on/off switch is stuck in one position and doesn’t move. I’m sad that we are out of warranty because we hadn’t gotten much use out of it.Other than that, this space heater is tiny but mighty. And it’s also super cute. We loved this heater and are sad it no longer works.

Title: Impressive Space Heater! A Mighty Mini!
Review Content: This space heater puts out the impressive amount of heat. I was unable to find another 1500 W heater in this size, and I have bought three small space heaters this season. The other two I have purchased include a popular one called Andily, which is a basic black space heater, and a turquoise one that I got for the cute factor and looks like a radio.The Isiler is also unlike the others in that it puts out a radiant like heat, instead of a wind/blowing convective like heat. It’s like comparing the heat of a blow dryer to that of a stack of hot Chi straighteners; the heat coming out is soft yet strong from the ceramic plates. The heater is also a lot smaller than I anticipated: I thought it was going to be 10 to 12 inches long from the stock photos. But as you can tell from the photos with my pug, it is actually a small cube, comparable to the Amazon basics mini heater.For the price $32, it is a decent deal. I would recommend it! I have not had it for more than a few weeks, so I cannot attest to the quality in terms of longevity, but the amount of heat and portability is unbeatable.The only downside is a mysterious short/spark that happens on the inside every time you change the temperature. Whenever a certain heat element goes on or off, the spark happens. I have not noticed the spark happening on its own, only when you change the temperature (both up and down).

Title: This easily portable heater quickly warms a room.
Review Content: I need to save money on my home heating.  It makes sense to limit heat to the room I’ll occupy for an hour or so- hence, a room heater.  This Isiler 1500 watt heated my 10x15’ room within 30 mins. It shuts down (not off) when you lift it.  The bottom gets warm so I’m going to rest it on a wooden surface if I raise it off the floor/carpet.  It makes a low humming sound while running.  Turning the back knob regulates the heat - adding temperature markers would be helpful.  Tho I‘ve had this item less than 24 hours, I’m satisfied I purchased it.

Title: Don’t let the size fool you
Review Content: I bought this for my garage because my garage is my get away from 2 teens as a single mom. Sometimes I like to listen to things that they should concern themselves with. I live in Mi and the winter’s can be really cold. Especially at night which when the kids are in bed I like to talk on the phone and don’t want to wake them so I go in my garage. I’ve bought several little heaters that burn out on my probably cause I’m so cold I sit in front of them. This one heats my whole garage after after 20mins. I have to sit far away from it. I even have one of the over head heaters you put on the wall but all that does is burn your heat and once it gets 35* it does nothing. This one is definitely a winner! If it can keep me warm in a 2 car garage it will definitely heat up a room.

Title: Puts out A LOT of heat
Review Content: I've had an Opolar electrical heater for a couple years and it puts out a decent amount of heat for a small living room, I was looking for something a little more aggressive without going for a $100+ oil heater with no fan. I'd had this on my wishlist for a while and when it was being phased out for $25 I snatched one and am completely satisfied. You will have to assemble the handle and base mount using a screwdriver, but unless you're completely uncoordinated, you should be able to pull it off. The metal housing definitely heats up (hence the plastic handle), but the cutoff switch should keep it from bursting into flames. Unlike the Opolar, if it gets tipped over, the heater cuts off, but the fan keeps running. Still, considering the amount of heat this outputs, which is pretty aggressive, it's worth the compromise. So far it hasn't tripped any fuses, which is more than I can say for some of the portable oil heaters I've used. For the price, if you're looking to dial down your gas bill without freezing to death, this heater fits the bill.

Title: Just Pros and Cons
Review Content: Pros 1. Similar products at this price range are not well built as this one. Body is probably metallic, not cheap plastic 2. Designed to sit with the grille facing upwards at an angle. So no need to tilt it while in action. 3. Much smaller than what you can guess from the pictures. It won't heat up any corner of your garage (which is why I bought it), BUT, when powered on for about half an hour, then even at low fan setting  the thing is capable of raising room temp by 5 degrees. Not kiddin.Cons 1. Not suitable for garage use. 2. Power consumption is 1500W, but that's standard for any decent space heater. Not sure if it consumes less energy at low setting. Hopefully it does,  as mentioned in the marketing writeups. In any case I do not use it for more than 15 to 20 mins occassionally. As mentioned above,  15 to 20 mins at a stretch is enough to raise room temp by 6 degrees.3. Power switch is at the back of the unit.

Title: This little heater works well for larger spaces than the write-up says it does!
Review Content: This is the fourth time I've purchased a space heater, ever, and this is the one I've liked the best. It's small and light enough to work from virtually anywhere I want to use it. I'm disabled, so being able to carry things from room to room is an issue at times, however this one is literally lighter than my purse. It's quiet enough for me to forget it's there after a few seconds. It's this bright, cheery yellow color, so I didn't have any problems finding it in the shed this winter, all mixed in among other things once the nights started getting cold again. What else? Oh! My cat didn't like it at first but she figured it out quickly and she loves it now. It doesn't smell all plastic-y like another one I still have. And it's cute. That's not SO important, probably. I just find I enjoy cute, useful things more than I would if they weren't cute at all. Overall, I feel like I picked a winner! And if I need to get another space heater, I'll probably get this exact one again.

Title: So far, so good.
Review Content: I did tons of research and read tons of reviews before buying this heater for supplemental heat in our small bathroom after showers. (It is far from any potential contact with water or wet hands). Just about every heater has bad reviews ranging from fires, to electrical issues, to malfunctions, to just stopping working out of the blue. So I figure any heater is a crap shoot. We chose this one and have had it for about 5 months. So far, so good. No fires, no chemical stink, no hot plug/cord, no malfunction.When I first set it up, I fiddled until I found the lowest setting that will produce good heat. I leave it at that setting and, rather than turning it on and off with each use, I plug/unplug it. I figure this reduces the odds of parts wearing out and also reduces the odds of a fire. I have only praise for this heater. It warms the room in jiffy. One thing I will add is to be sure the little bottom-thing on the bottom stays depressed (in other words, make sure the heater is hard, flat surface when in use), as the button is the safety feature mechanism that disables the heat in case the heater tips over. It it becomes un-depressed, the heater will only blow cold air.

Title: Great heater
Review Content: These are great little heaters. We have 3 of them now and they all work great! Easy to move around and it has automatic shutoff if it's knocked over

Title: Trying a second unit now
Review Content: The ceramic elements cost as much as this unit which is why I bought it.  Sturdy chassis, nice on/off switch and it has a transformer to power the 12vdc fan.  The fan is suitable for the heat generated.  My thermostat failed within  a few hours if it ever worked but that wasn't a problem since I planned to use a Penn/Johnson Control 421 box to control temp.  I bypassed the shoddy thermostat voiding the warranty and making me liable for whatever might occur.  It has a snap switch to cut power to the elements which I left in place and I didn't test the snap switch.Update: seller  saw my feedback and offered to replace the unit at no charge which I didn't expect but accepted.  The replacement unit is working as intended so I'm revising my rating.This item suffers from the same issue I see more every day; the imports coming from china are getting worse constantly.  Buy this item or buy another they all have the same problem; ship cheap junk as cheap as possible with no regard to quality control.

Title: This heater is simple, quiet, and packs enough punch to heat 2 adjoining rooms -- buy it.
Review Content: This is a great little heater! Our home's central heating unit broke just before the polar vortex shut down the state of TX. We had temps plummet to as low as 7°F as ice and snow covered everything and took our electric grid to near death. Inside our house was 34°F. We didn't have running water for 3 days, but we were lucky to have electricity. Honestly, I don't know why we did as everyone who lived in the neighborhood around us did not. I digress. I ordered this heater in the fall and planned to use it in the garage when I'm out there tinkering around. Honestly, I thought it would be a weak heater, being it is so small. When temps plummeted this week, I brought it in to keep us alive. I was seriously surprised how much output the thing has. It, alone, heated our livingroom and kitchen, and it did it without making much sound at all. My dogs would run through and accidentally knock it over, but the safety features kicked in and turned the heater off before any thing catastrophic occurred.I'm a fan of this heater. It's easy to use;  plug it in and turn it on.  Both the power and temp control dials are on the back and simple to use.I've got the thing in my room now, and I'm too warm.The temp is well-regulated and stays stable. Be aware that the casing gets warmer than just warm but not quite stove hot-  so maybe keep small children and cheese slices away from it.I recommend this heater.

Title: So Hot It Blew My Mind
Review Content: I'm in a low-income rental situation where the heating is problematic. I had the gas company just come and turn off the wall heater completely. Then I bought this heater. I live alone, so I just put it a couple feet away from where I'm sitting and the results are amazing. At 3AM in late October in Northern California, I put it on for five minutes and was warm for about an hour. I was just stunned. Before that a friend gave me a typical space heater he bought from an ordinary hardware store, a good enough brand and not-bad performance. But when I bought this one (barely wider than my hand) I was blown away. The other space heater struggled along all night and still it was hard to feel warm. This one seems like it was some other order of technology beyond whatever I knew before. (And I think my energy bill will be low because if I don't even need to have it on very long, I don't think I'll be running up a very big bill.) Note: I spend most of my time in a 9 x 10 room in front of a desk area about  5 x 5, so this may not apply to people who need to heat large areas involving multiple people (and so on that matter you might have to check other reviews, but if you're single and the space involved is small, I think you'll have it made with this device). No wonder it's currently sold out. Word must have gotten out already.

Title: Very nice little heater
Review Content: I love the metal construction of this unit and for it's small physical size and seemingly low volume fan, it does a great job at heating a room. It cost ~$32 when I bought mine, and evidently went up in price since then. I think the new price is pushing it a bit considering what else is available in a similar price range, but it's still a decent buy. The only down side to it is the fan, which runs constantly. The heat cycles on and off, but there's no way to shut the fan off without shutting down the unit completely. So there's noise to deal with, and it makes your spouse question how much it will cost to run since "it's always running!" The plus side to the design is that it seems to maintain a better balance of heat than units which shut the fan off when not heating, and I'm sure the cool-down effect of leaving the fan on will extend the life of the unit.

Title: Small and warm
Review Content: This heater is nice and small. Comes with feet that you have to attach that places it at an angle which is nice. We use ours to warm the bathroom as we give our kids a bath. It’s pretty quiet. It gets warm. The only down side is that the outside of the heater gets hot so it would not be good if you have little kids around. It does have an emergency off if it tilts or is lifted by the handle of which is a nice safety feature. It is compact enough to bring on vacation or for a camper.

Title: The best space heater you will find
Review Content: This was my third purchase of iSiLER space heater. The design has been improved with the same powerful performance.When the heater is turned on, it instantly start to provide heat. Since it has a compact size, it's portable and easy to relocate or to store in the off-season. Along with the thermostatic control dial, the constructional design of the heater prevents it from being tipped over. It also has tip-over overheat protection. It has a compact body yet produces a sufficient amount of heat.One of my previously purchased heater started to shut off by itself and I contact the customer service. iSiLER customer service responded very quickly with their full attention to my issue. I am more than happy with their excellent customer support to resolve the issue even though it was out of warranty.In conclusion, I highly recommend this iSiLER space heater to be the most value for the money device in terms of quality, performance, price and customer service.

Title: Best Compact Heater on the Market
Review Content: The ISILER Portable Ceramic Electric Space Heater is a win win for any small area.  This small ceramic style heater pumps out an amazing stream of heat.  It has a very nice non-slip support leg stance that keep the heater perfectly positioned.  With proper positioning, the space heater can be placed in a lower area beneath your workspace and provide a steady stream of heat to your area for ultimate comfortI like this heater because of the price, the look and style uniqueness and the safety fearers that prevent the heater from staying on if tipped over.  This heater gets an A+ rating in my book and is perfect for the house or any apartment.

Title: BEAST! This thing could heat up a GARAGE!!!
Review Content: I live in MA, the winters here can get pretty cold(can get into negative). I've had this running on a 14 degree (F) day on my back porch, which has little to none insulation, and this thing heats up the entire room (20ft L x 10ft W), with ease. I've actually had to shut it off when I'm in a t shirt and sweatpants, and this is on the medium setting. This was worth every penny. I've had it for about 3 weeks now and so far so good. I will update if anything goes wrong, if there is no update, then there has been zero problems.Also, some people are saying that this thing messes with your breakers and such. Of course, it is 1500w, if you dont have it plugged into either its own receptacle, or a power surge protector with the appropriate wattage, then its gonna trip it so you don't short everything. Either plug it into its own socket or get a power strip/surge protector with the appropriate wattage of the items you'll be plugging into it.In conclusion, if you are cold and want to be warm and not spend $100+ on an oil heater, etc, then this is 1000% your answer, I would recommend it to anyone and everyone who was in need of a space heater. 10/10Disclaimer: Havent had to turn it to the 5th setting as there has been no need.

Title: This cute, yellow heater saved my life!
Review Content: When the full measure of winter body slams New York City like a Canadian avalanche, a part of my soul flutters away with the brisk joy of autumn. My only spiritual salvation is the heat that clinks, clanks, clacks out of my rowdy radiator. Usually, it does its job and keeps my pale ass warm; but recently, my building's boiler has been finnicky—or perhaps my landlord is getting greedier and wants me to die a human icicle. Thus, I desperately needed a space heater when temperatures started dipping below the 20s. Thankfully, ISLER came to the rescue and thawed out my seasonal depression.When I first unveiled this winsome, little thing from its packaging, I was immediately struck by its sleek design—it looks exactly as advertised, unlike many online products that are buffed out and beautified by nice lighting. It was able to easily heat up my room (400 sq. ft.) after 5 minutes The same went for a bigger space in the apartment, our living room (1200 sq. ft.). The fan noise it emits is pleasant enough and can even double as a white noise machine— a big bonus if you have issues with obnoxious roommates or outdoor noise pollution.If you are looking for a relatively cheap space heater that is aesthetically pleasing and highly portable, ISLER has done a pretty good job of checking all the boxes. 10/10.

Title: Effective heater
Review Content: I've used this heater in my tiny house for a few weeks now, and - wow - it has been an extremely cold winter, so I think I have put this heater through its paces. The big upside for me is that I can plug this heater into a (separately purchased) wifi-connected smart plug on a timer, which allows me to leave the house for a few days at a time and keep the house as warm as I need by simply turning on the wifi plug with my phone. There is a safety toggle on the bottom that would turn off the heater if it tipped over, and a simply on/off switch that doesn't require resetting in case of a power outage. The heater uses up to 1500 watts on full power, and the fan is able to distribute that through the tiny house (8 x 18 ft) nicely. Obviously I'm space limited, so the tiny size (shorter than my Nalgene - I can easily store it in a drawer during summer) and happy yellow color are great features for me! Happy with my order - I'll update if anything changes.

Title: Perfect for our greenhouse
Review Content: This heater is perfect for our greenhouse.  It is sturdy with a metal frame and is stable which removes the worry of a turnover.  Plus, it has a turnover safety feature so really is worry free.  The thermostat dial allows for temperature control and you just have to decide where to set that based on outside temps.  It puts out a good amount of heat and as an example, it keeps our 100sqft greenhouse (which has lots of leaky windows) around 60 degrees F on nights where the outside temp is 30F.  It also kept it around 50F on a night that dropped to about 18F recently.

Title: Excellent space heater
Review Content: I ordered the iSiLER small mint green colored space heater from Amazon - it is perfect!! I use it to heat the kitchen while I’m prepping food, to keep me warm on the floor doing yoga, and sometimes while watching TV or reading in the evening. It’s so warm I can usually heat the space in a few minutes - especially if I’m moving around.The design is modern and streamlined - looks great in my house… The housing stays cool so if you touch the sides, top, bottom, you don’t get burned. The automatic cut-off works well - stops if it is tipped or knocked over.This heater is a great value. I highly recommend it!!

Title: Powerful!
Review Content: When I first plugged this little unit in I was a little disappointed - I wanted a heater fan that would blow on me like a hair dryer on turbo-high. I realize I was being unrealistic. It doesn’t do that. But it does blow a good quantity of heated air and the most AMAZING THING is that this little yellow guy heats my master bedroom up in about 3 minutes. It outperforms the big tower heater I have in my master bathroom. I turn them both on in the morning at the same time, and by the time I’ve made my bed the bedroom is warm; then I go to the bathroom and the difference in temp is palpable. The tower heater is doing its best, and I used to think it was good enough, but that was before I bought the iSiler.  This unit is small, and when in use the top of it does get warm, the the bottom of it does not. The handle is perfect for adjusting the unit left or right, the on/off switch at the back is large and easily felt with fingertips, no spinning unit around to find the switch, and I have not detected any “burnt” smell coming from it when I turn it off like you sometimes do with heaters.It’s small enough to fit on my tiny nightstand with room left over for a lamp and a coaster. PERFECT!!

This unit is small, and when in use the top of it does get warm, the the bottom of it does not. The handle is perfect for adjusting the unit left or right, the on/off switch at the back is large and easily felt with fingertips, no spinning unit around to find the switch, and I have not detected any “burnt” smell coming from it when I turn it off like you sometimes do with heaters.It’s small enough to fit on my tiny nightstand with room left over for a lamp and a coaster. PERFECT!!

Title: Super small, questionable effectiveness, heat element turns off quickly on its own.
Review Content: This is a super cute little heater.  It is definitely little though.  Even despite reading the reviews it is somehow small than I expected.  My heater arrived slightly damaged, its bottom metal corner apparently bent, and the box was not damaged.  For an item I admired the aesthetic of, this was a little disappointing.  I went ahead and gave it a try though.  You need to attach the plastic handle and feet first with a screwdriver.  Not that hard, but it appears to have been done just to make it fit better in a box and save 1 inch of space?  The initial experience could be improved with better boxing.I was excited to try this out though.  Controls are simple and it feels substantial and robust for its tiny size.  I have a small room, 8x10, I wanted to try this in as it is always cold in there.  I set it on the floor and let it run.  Warm air was coming out and things seemed off to a good start.  I came back in 10 minutes and the fan was blowing cold air and the room was still just as cold.  Apparently this is one of the features, that the fan blows whether the heater is on or not.  I wasn't even considering that, mainly wondering why it had stopped heating.  The thermostat dial was on highest level, but it was definitely still cold in the room.  I turned it off and on, and it started blowing warm air again.  I came back in 2 minutes to the same result.Ultimately I'm not sure whats going on, but know these things have a feature that disables the heater temporarily if it gets too hot, blowing regular air until it cools a bit.  The problem for me was that it seems to be kicking in well before any usefulness of the heater is even achieved!  Sometimes turning on/off helps, other times it stays cold air.  I can't even say its defective, as it will blow warm air again at some point.Feature or not, that experience was a deal breaker for me.  This thing might be good under a desk to warm your feet for 30 seconds, but it is useless as a heater expected to blow warm air with any consistency.

Title: ON/OFF switch
Review Content: Almost ordered a second one today when my first one decided to quit running. The only off switch, like other people in the reviews are saying melted and will no longer turn the heater on or off. Contemplated changing the switch but I believe it wouldn't last very long again. Undersized wiring maybe? I'm not a electrical engineer, but the days seem to be numbered on how long the switch lasts.

Title: Updated Review
Review Content: Updated 8/2/2024- The seller reached out and offered to make this right which I am greatly appreciative of. Based on that alone, I do recommend this seller and hope they can improve their product.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------This heater was a waste of money. It can’t be used in a large open area (i.e. a living room) as the heat just dies. It seems to work ok in a room with a closed door but doesn’t help me if I want to move it around the room. I did give it a star for being really cute and easy to move around but that’s it. I will be returning this and buying something else.

Title: Great performance in a small form factor!
Review Content: So far this little heater is VERY impressive! My office area is 12’ x 18’ and before purchasing this item I would have to heat the top floor which was obviously pretty costly. After getting this device I truly had my doubts based on the size alone. I can say I was shocked to feel how warm the room had become.The only down side is it would be nice to have some kind of indication of the temperature setting by number or whatnot. If you happen to get it “just right” then lose that setting for whatever reason you don’t really have a great point of reference to get back to. The only other issue is that it would be nice if the fan actually turned off when the unit wasn’t blowing but I can see this also being a feature as to cool the heating coils in between heating an area.That’s really the only “complaints” if one was to ask for any cons to this item. So far it works very well and the white noise from the fan becomes unnoticeable like having a desk fan on all day.

Title: Isiler really gets it!
Review Content: I bought the product as a personal heater while working at my bench in the garage in the winter. The product did exactly what I thought it would. I probably only used the heater about 60 times in three years. One day it wouldn’t turn on. I contacted the isiler company and they were prompt to reply with a number of trouble shooting solutions. Unfortunately none worked but were willing to work with me and suggested I share my experience with Amazon. In turn they would replace my heater.

Title: Most economic compact space heater for the price.
Review Content: I am totally satisfied with my Isiler 1500 w space heater. I now have two units in different rooms. I thoroughly researched and read reviews of several compact space heaters before purchasing my first unit. It has exceeded my expectations. It comes fully assembled. Just take it out of the box and plug it in and it starts providing instant heat. It's compact and portable and easy to relocate or to store in the off-season. It is constructed so that it is unlikely to tip over and it also has tip-over overheat protection and thermostatic control. It produces a surprising amount of heat for such a compact unit. Isiler has excellent very responsive customer support service to respond to any questions or issues. Overall I found this Isiler space heater to be the most economic unit when considering quality, performance and price.

Title: Gets the job done
Review Content: Got this little guy because of the rise in natural gas prices making home heating next to impossible without spending your paycheck on the gas bill alone. I have solar so an electric heater seemed the way to go, well myself and everyone else seemed to have the same idea. So unless I wanted to drop a pretty penny on a larger heater I was doomed to freeze, or so I thought. After tons of searching and reading reviews, I found this little lifesaver on Amazon and could not be happier! Works fantastic for your average size room (a little struggle for those larger areas, but still helps). Could not be happier with this heater for the price, and it's really cute!

Title: These little heaters are amazing
Review Content: I live at 7400 ft in Colorado, so winters get cold and stay cold.  It's a balmy 12 degrees out right now and going down to 6 tonight.  My garage is insulated (the doors not so much) and is 700 sq ft with a 10 ft ceiling, so I figured I'd buy two of these little guys.  They are really small.  I promise you'll be surprised and skeptical when you open the box! Anyway, I have both of them turned on to almost the lowest setting and the garage is 59 degrees.  If I'm going to use my workbench, I'll turn the thermostat to a medium setting and give them an hour or so to get up to the high 60's.  I'm not sure if only one of these small inexpensive heaters would be sufficient to keep the chill off a garage this size because it would probably have to run constantly.  Anyway, I'm happy I replaced my 5,500 watt 240 v heater with two of these 1500 watt heaters.  They definitely will pay for themselves in energy savings this year while keeping the garage warmer.  I'll write a follow-up if they don't last.  We'll see.

Title: Small but MIGHTY!
Review Content: This little space heater generates heat like nothing else! My fiance is always cold even when he's practically bundled up like Kenny from South Park in the house. He runs cold on his extremities. This little heater on low is under his desk, and man, does it heat up his office area quickly! He uses it on low for 15 minutes to take the chill off. I bought one for my mom to take the chill off of her while she's in one area of the house. She loves it! We don't use it for hours. We use it on an as needed basis. My mom had it on for an hour on low and was amazed at how much heat came out of this little heater! It's small, but it's mighty on the heat that it generates.

Title: The safety is a false hope
Review Content: Bought in October 2019. It is now July 1st 2020. If I do math correctly, it lasted under 9 months. I had another brand just like this prior and it just straight blew up, but that's for their review. This one suffers the exact same chinesium flaws but I notice them now.It heats well, it's 1,500W and should clearly only be used solo in a 15A socket (nothing else in that socket, please) and can keep a room warm. What eventually happens to these is that the safety switch fails even if you never touch the thing. What position does the safety fail in? Who knows...open Schrödinger's box. This particular model will not work if it's sitting up-right. You have to physically push it over and it works. Uhhhh, that's not how this works. Slowly tilt it up and you can trick the safety to stay on, but that's not right. It only works when it's kicked over and a fire hazard? I never touch the thing but to turn it on or off.Buy at your own risk. The others that are exactly like this started to do this too and I tricked it to keep working which was a bad idea; I know. It all eventually trickles down to working while tipped over, the thermostat is borked, it stays on, resistance grows because it's trying very hard to catch your house on fire, then the switch melts and luckily when the wires droop and touch it trips a breaker. A flash in the heater and I just happened to blow a socket which was probably weak already (It was not wired on the lugs, those nasty Press-into-the-back terminations).I'm playing with it right now, it's only running when it's face is down and turns off when I get it to about 45-degrees to correct. Same, exact, thing I had prior. Entire failure but is good until it isn't. I wouldn't buy this thing at all. Going to tear this apart so nobody can never use it again.

Title: Great little heater, Even better Customer Service
Review Content: I used this heater off and on for the last two years. Usually as a backup for our other space heaters due to the size of the Isiler.  Somehow this little thing just kept on chugging.About a month ago, I tried to turn it on and the button stuck. Very odd to me. I unplugged it thinking it was a safety feature but no matter how long I waited/it just didn't budge. I'm sure a better electrical mind could diagnose the problem but I contacted the team at Isiler and after a quick back and forth with them, despite being out of warranty by nearly a year, they replaced it... Really can't complain there!Ann is great and the products do what they need to do.

Title: We Had A Good Run
Review Content: I bought this late January last year and I've been super impressed with it since. This little powerhouse comes in a happy yellow, is hot/cool adjustable, portable, not obnoxiously loud. It's perfect for my small bedroom and second floor landing which need help keeping heat in this 30 year old house.We were doing great, even on days where I've let it run over four hours straight (not all that often). However, I am writing this review a year later to say my little isiler has stopped working. The ON/OFF toggle is now locked and I don't know of any way to reset it. The red light at the bottom left front of the grill flashes when plugged in if I press on the locked toggle. But I guess there isn't going to be an cooperation.I think this is a decently priced heater for the power it gives and the range it can heat. But if it will only last a year or less . . . well, that's not economical. It is particularly concerning given that I have only used it in the winter. Which means it has only worked well for one full season. Say what?

Title: It’s smaller than the images look.
Review Content: You better be close or have it in a small, closed-off space. I put it at my calves on a plate when my heat went out.The cord is too short for such a little heater that needs to be so near. It probably says not to use an extension cord. They usually do. But  I’ll probably have to if I’m not sleeping with it like I am now with a plug nearby.I’ve had stronger little heaters this size, but they were electric coils, not ceramic, and therefore not as safe as this one. It shuts off if tips over. It also shut off when I kicked a blanket too near it and the heat built up.It’s attractive, but they should have painted the screws to match. It’s good for the price.

Title: Warmth, Efficiency, and Charm - A Heater That's a Game Changer!
Review Content: I recently purchased this small indoor heater to warm my feet as I work in my office. I couldn't be happier with my choice. This heater has truly exceeded my expectations in every way.First and foremost, the heating options are fantastic. With three different modes, it's incredibly versatile. Whether you need a quick blast of warmth on those colder days or just a gentle breeze on warmer ones, this heater has you covered. The safety features are also a big plus. The automatic shutoff when it's knocked over or reaches a high temperature provides peace of mind that I greatly appreciate.One of the standout features of this heater is its speed. It heats up my small space lightning fast, and it's virtually silent. No annoying fan noise to disrupt my concentration or my sleep. It's perfect for a cozy night in, reading, or just getting some well-deserved rest.Size matters, and this heater is both compact and powerful. It fits perfectly in my office or bedroom. It's not just a heater; it's a stylish piece that adds a touch of retro charm to my space. I've even considered buying more as gifts for friends and family, and the upcoming holiday season seems like the perfect occasion!This little indoor heater is a five-star addition to my life. It's functional, safe, fast, and quiet - all in a chic, compact package. I can't recommend it enough, and I'm sure you'll love it just as much as I do. Stay warm and cozy all year round with this fantastic little heater!

Title: Keeps me warm!!! So cute too!

Title: Cuts the Cold
Review Content: This little heater is perfect for my hybrid, roaming work schedule.  I work in different offices around town and being able to put this in my bag is a lifesaver, especially since I tend to get cold easily.  I put it on the floor of the office, close the door and it heats up the entire room, plus keeps my toes and legs really warm.  It does the same thing if you put it on the desk, but it does kick out a fair amount of heat so make sure it's not too close.  I like that the first switch is just a cool flow of air so if the opposite were ever true and I need circulation this would work too (it's not really cold).  Very stylish, easy to use, only thing that keeps it from being 5 stars is that the chord is not that long, but it works in a pinch.

Title: Great Little Heater
Review Content: So to preface this review I bought this for in front of my dogs little sofa/couch/bed thing that he lays on. I like to crack a window in the window for fresh air and we keep his fur short so I want him to be comfortable with warm. Even with blankets I want him to stay cozy, and feel that if he needs to warm up he can. I grabbed this lil guy for my pupper and it's perfect. It's slightly bigger than two iphones put together and outputs enough heat to just keep you very comfy. When he was walking around I sat in front of it and was actually quite impressed. So I may grab another one for myself hah. It doesn't burn, or pump out 200 degree heat, which is a huge plus for me. While it doesn't flamethrow magma levels of heat and burn you, it's very solid to keep you at a perfect comfy warm level of warm. Huge plus for me, again as i'm normally always burning up even when cold. Safety features are standard and nice, in case it does knock over you won't burn your home down, and the look of it is very nice. I got the blue color and the gold hardware on the blue heater looks very upscaled and classy. I could easily see this on an office desk, or at your feet as way to keep your toes warm. The power cord is about 3 feet, so you may need to get an extension chord. It also has a cool setting that blows a bit of cold air at you which might be nice to use as a way to dry a painting, or your nails, which i'll eventually try. It's also super lightweight and the build quality feels durable. I'd highly recommend it.

Title: This is going right back.
Review Content: This heater is cute and a very nice color.  That's about the only positive things I can say about it, though. It took moving it to several different surfaces before it would even start to run.  As several people have indicated in reviews, the safety button beneath the heater has to be engaged before the heater will work.  The button must be too short otherwise it should work on any flat surface it is set upon.  Once I got this heater to turn itself on, I left it running for about 20-25 minutes in a small, closed bedroom.  After that time, the room was not at all noticeably warmer.  More alarming, there was an odd odor coming from the heater.  Much more alarming, the black grill on the front of the machine was scorching hot.  I accidently brushed my fingers on it and was sorry I did.  Safety feature or not, if this heater were to fall over, I believe it might cause a fire or seriously injure someone who innocently touched it.  As soon as this thing cooled down, it was in the box and on its way back to Amazon.

As soon as this thing cooled down, it was in the box and on its way back to Amazon.

Title: After 3 years
Review Content: Use it in a small 14" camper. It has heated well in 40F when run on medium, which is about 400 watts. In a pinch, we have used a 1500 watt inverter (powered off the truck) to easily power it.  Also have used a small gas generator which powers it just off idle speed so its not very noisy. If left on hi setting it is too hot for us, but warms the space up sooner. The main thing is, the heater draws comparatively less wattage than most others, yet provides good, quiet heat.

Title: Disappointed but should I be surprised?
Review Content: Pros:-Puts out a surprising amount of heat despite how small it is. In an hour or two of use I can shut it off because it has warmed up my entire office, which is quite drafty.-Very cute design-It will shut off if you barely tap it, which is a pro for me because I'm always worried about starting a fire.-Cord is long enough that I can plug it in and set it on top of my desk to warm my icy little typing hands.Cons:-I've had this heater for maybe 2 months. I use it a couple of hours a day, an average of 4 days a week. The lowest of the 3 settings no longer heats. The fan blows but the heating element is not coming on. It now only heats on levels 2 and 3, which are a bit noisier.-It intermittently makes a very loud rattling noise, which makes me think something is coming loose inside of it. This increases my fear of it eventually catching fire do to mechanical failure.Overall I just wish it had lasted longer. If this was a year later I wouldn't be surprised. Things like this never last long these days, but it didn't even make it through an entire cold season before it began exhibiting problems.

Title: Aesthetic,Warm and functional air blower
Review Content: I literally just received this product on a cold rainy day and pleasantly surprised by how functional this air blower it! It is more like a desktop/tabletop space heater and the blower when connected to plug blows warm air. It has 3 different settings for how warm you want.. I was happy with it being on 1 since it was placed fairly close to me but you can adjust the setting based on the distance. Being portable and easy to carry from one place to other as long as you have place to plug it in. And it looks so pretty( reminded me of small radios but the color and design is beautiful)! So far very happy with the product.

Title: Lots of heat in a little package
Review Content: I finally needed to pull this out of the box today. My office gets chilly and I wanted something that would fit on my desk to warm my poor cold fingers as I type. This definitely packs a punch! It take a couple minutes to warm up but once it does it's great.The only issue I've had is the safety button on the bottom. There's a cylinder-shaped plastic piece that comes out of the bottom and for the heater to activate it has to be pressed in - this allows it to shut off quickly if it's knocked over. Great feature but mine doesn't go low enough to touch the desk!!!  My work around was to fold up a sticky note underneath it to hit that button. Luckily the exterior plastic part doesn't get hot.

Title: A great little heater
Review Content: I love this little heater!  I use it in my 1995 16' Casita RV to keep warm on cold nights - it is an amazing little heater.  My RV is fully solar/battery powered and amazingly this little heater is so low energy that even on a 22F night with the heater set on low heat, it kept the interior of the camper in the low 60's - but did not draw the batteries down very far!I also use it to keep the pipes from freezing when I am not using the camper but do not want to drain the pipes for the winter just yet.  I have it plugged into a wifi controlled outlet/timer set to come on every few hours for long enough to keep the temp above freezing so the pipes don't freeze.Its safety switch is a great feature just in case it tips over.I recommend this heater.

Title: Exactly what I was looking for.
Review Content: I don't write a lot of reviews but I am very happy with this heater and I appreciate using the reviews in deciding which products to buy.I need local heat for use in my downstairs home office which tends to be colder than the rest of the house.  I put the heater under my desk on the floor. The 400 watt setting is more than adequate most of the time. I can hear the fan but it is just a whisper and quieter than my 2 previous electric space heaters. I also use it in my garage workshop which in not heated otherwise and the 900 watt setting keeps my local work area warm enough. I plan to use it in my van conversion RV and wanted to keep the power draw below 1000 watts. It is very compact and  will be easy to store in our limited storage area. I also expect to use it as a summer cooling fan. The heater quickly shuts off if it is tipped.

It's much more durable than my Honeywell heater which quit working after only a few months.

Title: Works great!
Review Content: I live in a small condo with 1600 sq ft. It has a loft and a downstairs area, where I have a 30’ ceiling in the living room. So, the furnace goes out. The living room area, has the 30’ ceiling. Its 36* outside. I plugged this small heater in…ot was 65* inside and starting to drop more. Within 5 minutes it not only heated the living room but the kitchen and downstairs bedroom!!!!Amazing heater with several safety features to ease your mind! Thank goodness my neighbors lent me theirs till mine came in the next day!

It's very quiet, as you can hear in attached video and this was the high setting, too.

Title: The little heater that can
Review Content: This is my second Comfort Zone heater.  The first one died after much use, so I'm OK with that.  Use in a 1200 sq ft slightly insulated sunroom, and it is able to warm it up, so long as the outside temp is over 40 degrees.  Like the size and rotation and simplicity.  Use a smart plug as a timer.  The power light is very dim in daylight and not at all useful.  I have never been able to set the thermostat properly.  It is simple to set, but then it fails to start or turns off too soon.  It's not a big problem if you operate manually or use a smart plug with Alexa.

Title: Little heater with great power

Title: Safety features are problematic
Review Content: For some reason, this heater will be running on high and then just inexplicably stop sending out heat (even though its on). And then randomly it will turn back on again. But if this is a safety feature, it doesn't actually help because I want the heater on full blast and then to turn it off when I am warm enough. Because this automatically turns off (even when on high and full blast) I forget that it's actually on and still plugged in, which is more problematic than just being able to turn it off because i'm at the correct temperature. I wish I had saved the box to return it before realizing this. STAY AWAY if you want to heat yourself to the temperature you want, rather than whatever this thing is doing.
